Parameter.Notes: Accelerometer Recalibration Threshold is the difference between stored Calibration angles and newly calculated Calibration angle, in Degrees, that will trigger a recalibration. 0 will default to 10 degrees. 255 will disable this feature.

Parameter.name: Driver Behaviour Event Mask
Parameter.Help: Driver Behaviour Event Mask
Parameter.Notes:
Driver Behaviour Event Mask. To get configuration value calculate the total value by adding the individual event values together. A value of 65535 will enable all events and 0 will disable all events. Speeding 1 Excessive RPM 2 Excessive IDLE 4 Free Wheeling 8 Acceleration 16 Braking 32 Cornering 64 Swerving 128 Accident 256 Lane change 512 Speed Bump 1024 Roll 2048 Pitch 4096
e.g ( Speeding + Cornering + Accident ) = ( 1 + 64 + 256 ) = 321

Parameter.name: Standard Deviation Magnitude Threshold
Parameter.Help: This sets the magnitude threshold for the Standard Deviation calculation. This is the minimum magnitude that vibrations need to exceed trigger the Standard Deviation flag, lockout or burst data. Standard Deviation is used to detect whether the device experiences excessive vibration due to it being mounted incorrectly. This mechanism can be used to detect excessive vibration and also lockout the accident detection mechanism if excessive vibration is present.
Parameter.Notes: This sets the magnitude threshold for the Standard Deviation calculation. This is the minimum magnitude that vibrations need to exceed trigger the Standard Deviation flag, lockout or burst data. Standard Deviation is used to detect whether the device experiences excessive vibration due to it being mounted incorrectly. This mechanism can be used to detect excessive vibration and also lockout the accident detection mechanism if excessive vibration is present. n StdDev = N x 0.02 0.4 StdDev = 20 1.0 StdDev = 50

Parameter.name: Standard Deviation Minimum Time
Parameter.Help: This sets the minimum time threshold for the Standard Deviation calculation. This is the minimum duration that vibrations need to be present to trigger the Standard Deviation flag, lockout or burst data. Standard Deviation is used to detect whether the device experiences excessive vibration due to it being mounted incorrectly. This mechanism can be used to detect excessive vibration and also lockout the accident detection mechanism if excessive vibration is present.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This sets the minimum time threshold for the Standard Deviation calculation. This is the minimum duration that vibrations need to be present to trigger the Standard Deviation flag, lockout or burst data. Standard Deviation is used to detect whether the device experiences excessive vibration due to it being mounted incorrectly. This mechanism can be used to detect excessive vibration and also lockout the accident detection mechanism if excessive vibration is present.

Parameter.name: Z-Axis DeltaV Impact Threshold
Parameter.Help: This sets the threshold for Z-Axis impacts (Impacts in the vertical axis, such as potholes and road irregularities) The lowest that this can be set to is a deltaV of 1. If it could be set to a lower value than this, it will result in excessive false accidents. n deltaV = N x 0.02 1 deltaV = 50 2 deltaV = 100
Parameter.Notes: This sets the threshold for Z-Axis impacts (Impacts in the vertical axis, such as potholes and road irregularities) The lowest that this can be set to is a deltaV of 1. If it could be set to a lower value than this, it will result in excessive false accidents. n deltaV = N x 0.02 1 deltaV = 50 2 deltaV = 100

Parameter.name: Accident Analysis Event Delay
Parameter.Help: Accident Analysis Event Delay
Parameter.Notes: Accident Analysis Event Delay in seconds. An additional Accident Analysis Event will be generated N seconds after the first Accident Analysis Event e.g. when the accident was detected. 0 and 255 will disable this time delay. Maximum delay is 254 seconds or 4 minutes and 14 seconds

Parameter.name: Accident Reconstruction Log
Parameter.Help: Use Flash 1 or Data Flash Card for the Accident Reconstruction Log
Parameter.Notes: The MHub918 can record accident data to either the internal memory, or to the flash memory card inserted into the memory card slot on the underside of the MHub918 PCB. The ability to write the accident data into the memory card implies that a bigger memory card will be able to hold more accident information. The values are as follows: 0 = Internal Memory 1 = Expanded Memory

Parameter.name: Accident Reconstruction Log Sending Delay
Parameter.Help: Accident Reconstruction Log Sending Delay
Parameter.Notes: Accident Reconstruction Log Sending Delay in seconds. This parameter specifies how many seconds to wait after accident event to start sending Accident Reconstruction log. It allows for more Accident Reconstruction log entries after an accident.

Parameter.name: Accident Reconstuction Log History Depth
Parameter.Help: Accident Reconstuction Log History Depth
Parameter.Notes:
Accident Reconstuction Log History Depth is the number of events to send after an accident detection.
e.g. If configured with 120 ,the accident reconstruction Log will be sent from accident time + accident send delay - log history depth
Note: The maximum number of logs that can be sent as events is 600. If this value is larger than 600 it will default to 600.

Parameter.name: Both GPS and OBD speed in Second-by-Second logs
Parameter.Help: Include both the GPS and OBD speed in the Second-by-Second logs
Parameter.Notes: Include both the GPS and OBD speed in the Second-by-Second logs

Parameter.name: Enable Accident Reconstruction Logging
Parameter.Help: Enable Accident Reconstruction Logging
Parameter.Notes: Turning ON this parameter will enable the accident reconstruction functionality of the MHub918.

Parameter.name: Enable Burst Data Standard Deviation Events
Parameter.Help: Enable Burst Data Standard Deviation Events
Parameter.Notes: Enable Burst Data Standard Deviation Events

Parameter.name: Enable Data Streaming
Parameter.Help: Enable Data Streaming
Parameter.Notes: Enable Data Streaming

Parameter.name: Enable DDS streaming
Parameter.Help: Enable sending the journey log data in DDS format
Parameter.Notes: Enable sending the journey log data in DDS format

Parameter.name: Enable Excessive Acceleration Exception Log Send
Parameter.Help: Enable Sending of part of the Journey Log as events around the Excessive Acceleration Transgression
Parameter.Notes: Enable Sending of part of the Journey Log as events around the Excessive Acceleration Transgression

Parameter.name: Enable Full Rate Data Streaming
Parameter.Help: Enable Full Rate Data Streaming
Parameter.Notes: Enable Full Rate Data Streaming will send all accelerometer samples. If not enabled the data will be sub-sampled to 50 samples per second.

Parameter.name: Enable GPS Verbose Logging
Parameter.Help: Enable GPS Verbose Logging in Journey Log
Parameter.Notes: Enable GPS Verbose Logging in Journey Log

Parameter.name: Enable Harsh Braking Exception Log Send

Parameter.Notes: Enable Sending of part of the Journey Log as events around the Harsh Braking Transgression

Parameter.name: Enable Incident Burst Data

Parameter.Notes: Enables Burst Data for Incident type Accident Analysis Events

Parameter.name: Enable Second-by-Second Sending
Parameter.Help: Enable Second-by-Second Sending of the Trips in the Journey Log
Parameter.Notes: Enable Second-by-Second Sending of the Trips in the Journey Log

Parameter.name: Enable Speeding Exception Log Send
Parameter.Help: Enable Sending of part of the Journey Log as events around where the Speeding Transgression starts and end
Parameter.Notes: Enable Sending of part of the Journey Log as events around where the Speeding Transgression starts and end.

Parameter.name: Enable Standard Deviation Lockout
Parameter.Help: Enable Standard Deviation Lockout
Parameter.Notes: Enable Standard Deviation Lockout

Parameter.name: Enable Uncalibrated Accelerometer SBS
Parameter.Help: Enable Uncalibrated Accelerometer SBS
Parameter.Notes: Enable Uncalibrated Accelerometer SBS. Will always send accelerometer data with Second-by-Second data ignoring calibration state.

Parameter.name: Enable Valid Driver Check
Parameter.Help: Cancel Geoloc on trip start when driver validated
Parameter.Notes: Seeting this bit to 1 means that the geoloc will only be canceled when the driver has also been validated

Parameter.name: Enable Z-Axis Incidents
Parameter.Help: This enables accident detection for impacts in the z-axis (The z-axis is the vertical axis) These are typically impacts that are a result of potholes and road irregularities.
Parameter.Notes: This enables accident detection for impacts in the z-axis (The z-axis is the vertical axis) These are typically impacts that are a result of potholes and road irregularities.

Parameter.name: Exclude Position Info from Second-by-Second logs
Parameter.Help: Exclude any positional information from the Second-by-Second logs
Parameter.Notes: Exclude any positional information from the Second-by-Second logs

Parameter.name: Minimum Required Speed
Parameter.Help: Minimum Speed at which any accident reconstruction records will be written if this option is selected
Parameter.Notes: If parameter Verify Speed is enabled, the MHub is instructed to only record accident data if the speed if the vehicle is greater than the value specified in this parameter.

Parameter.name: Non Trip AR Log
Parameter.Help: Non Trip AR Log every 60s
Parameter.Notes: Non Trip AR Log every 60s

Parameter.name: Second-by-Second Sending during trip
Parameter.Help: Enable Second-by-Second sending of the Journey log during a trip
Parameter.Notes: Enable Second-by-Second sending of the Journey log during a trip. If this is not set the Second-by-Second sending of the trip would only happen when no trip is in progress.

Parameter.name: Use Second-by-Second version 2 records
Parameter.Help: By enabling this the logs reported will exclude the Z axis G-Force and include Altitude information
Parameter.Notes: By enabling this the logs reported will exclude the Z axis G-Force and include Altitude information

Parameter.name: Verify Ignition On
Parameter.Help: Only write accident reconstruction records if ignition is ON
Parameter.Notes: When accident reconstruction is enabled on the MHub, certain information is recorded every second that is to be used in the event of an accident to reconstruct the accident. Limitations can be placed on the recording of the accident data. Enabling this parameter will result in the accident data only being recorded when ignition is ON.

Parameter.name: Verify Speed
Parameter.Help: Set this bit to verify that the selected speed of the vehicle is greater than required minimum
Parameter.Notes: Accident reconstruction data is recorded every second. Limitations can be placed on the recording of data to ensure that only relevant data is recorded. The MHub does not really need to record data when the vehicle is standing still. If this value is enabled, then the accident recording will only occur if the speed of the vehicle is greater than the speed specified in the "Minimum Required Speed" parameter under the Accident Reconstruction section.

Parameter.name: Accelerometer Movement Threshold
Parameter.Help: Accelerometer Movement Threshold
Parameter.Notes: Accelerometer Movement Threshold used for alarm application. This is used in combination with Accelerometer Movement Delay

Parameter.name: Anti Theft Feature Enable
Parameter.Help: Anti Theft Feature Enable
Parameter.Notes: Anti Theft Feature Enable. Uses Accelerometer Motion Threshold and Delay settings ,Ignition and Input 2

Parameter.Help: Total Siren Time
Parameter.Notes: Total Siren Time in seconds. After Time-out Siren will go off. 0 will make siren time indefinite.

Parameter.name: Battery Temperature Charge Threshold
Parameter.Help: Battery Temperature Charge Threshold
Parameter.Notes: Battery Temperature Threshold for Mode 4 above which the battery charge will not start. Battery Charge start with Temperature equal or below threshold. Charge Terminates at threshold plus 10 degrees. If value is below 20 or above 100 degrees it will default to 35 degrees

Parameter.name: Enable Battery Charger
Parameter.Help: Enable Battery Charger
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
0 - Battery Charger is managed by Charging Hardware e.g. always on 1 - Battery Charger only active during ignition on 2 - Battery Charger Disabled 3 - Battery Charger Termination at 4.0v, resume at 3.9v n - Battery Charger is managed by Charging Hardware e.g. always on

!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
SLA Crank Percentage is the percentage of nominal voltage below which it would be considered a engine crank
Scaling 0.4 250 = 100 percent 125 = 50 percent

Parameter.name: SLA Crank Start Percentage
Parameter.Help: SLA Crank Start Percentage
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
SLA Crank Start Percentage is the percentage of nominal voltage below which it would be considered a engine crank
Scaling 0.4 250 = 100 percent 236 = 94 percent (12.0v if battery is 12.7v) 125 = 50 percent

Parameter.Notes:

Parameter.name: Comm. Policy 0 - Enable SMS
Parameter.Help: Enable SMS for Communications Medium Policy 0
Parameter.Notes:
As described previously, the MHub makes use of various communications mediums, such as SMS, GPRS, roaming SMS etc. And the MHub is configured with a order of priority of these communications mediums. Thus if GPRS is the highest priority, the MHub will always attempt to be in a position where it can send messages over GPRS.
The Communications Medium Policies (of which there are 8) are used to specify for individual events over what communicatiosn mediums the event may be transmitted.

Parameter.name: SMS DebounceTimer
Parameter.Help: Debounce Timer for SMS Communications Medium
Parameter.Notes:
The MHub can send data to Mprofiler over various communications mediums, such as SMS, GPRS, Satellite etc. There can be a total of 8 different communications mediums, some of which are still to be implemented.The communications Mediums implemented to date are: 1. SMS 2. GPRS 3. Roaming SMS 4. Roaming GPRS 5. Satellite 6. Wifi 7. Bluetooh 8. Other
The MHub is configured to use the communications mediums in order of priority. Thus an option will be to have GPRS as the highest priority, followed by SMS, and then perhaps Roaming GPRS. This is done in patameter "User CM Preference Order". What this means is that the MHub will always try to be in a position where it can send data over GPRS, and will send events that have been configured to be sent over GPRS. If however for some reason GPRS is not available, the MHub will fall back to the second priority medium which in this case will be SMS. Now events that have been configured to be sent over SMS will be sent.
The value of this parameter indicates the amount of time that the particular Communications Medium will be held after the MHub has deemed it to be unavailable, before dropping to the next available Communications Medium. This is to prevent messages being sent over SMS if GPRS becomes available for only a short while.
For example if the GPRS Debounce Timer was set to 120 seconds (times are in seconds for the debounce timers) and the GPRS network became unreachable then events that are marked for GPRS transmission will be extracted from the flash and queued for 120 seconds after GPRS has become unavailable.
Once 120 seconds has passed with no GPRS coverage the next available CM (SMS for example) determined from the "User CM Preference Order" will take over and the current queue will be destroyed and a new queue set up with events that must be sent over that particular CM. In this example, SMS.

Parameter.name: User CM Preference Order
Parameter.Help: Preference order of communications mediums usage as selected by user
Parameter.Notes:
As described in SMS DebounceTimer, the MHub is configured with a priority oder of the required communications mediums. This parameter is where this assignment is done. This is a string of 8 bytes represented as hexadecimal values where the highest priority medium is specified first then the second one, etc.
Each medium has a unique number they are: - 00: SMS - 01: GPRS - 02: Roaming SMS - 03: Roaming GPRS - 04: Iridium Satellite - 05: Wifi - 06: Bluetooth - 07: Other - 64: Not Used
As an example: Say we want to specify GPRS then SMS in that order and nothing else you would set it to: 0100646464646464
- or - Say you want to use only GPRS, then set it to 0164646464646464
default: 0100030264646464

Parameter.Notes: After a unit device plugin the Box Leds will always be active for the Box Led Override Time. Default 5min. 0 disables the features

Parameter.name: Enable All Debug
Parameter.Help: Switch all debug statements ON or OFF
Parameter.Notes: The value represents the debug time-out in minutes. Setting the value to 255 is a special case causing the debugs to be permanently active.

Parameter.name: Enable Box Leds
Parameter.Help: Enable Box Leds
Parameter.Notes: The MHub has 3 LED's that are used to indicate various operational states of teh MHub, this is particularly usefull during the installation and fault diagnosis processes to determine of the MHub is operating correctly. However from a vehicle being stolen scenario, flashing LED's will draw attention to the MHub. It is thus possible to turn OFF the LED's completely by disabling this parameter.

Parameter.Help: Enables the use of the RED Led for OBD operation diagnostics. Insurance LED style overrides this setting. Off - No OBD operation. Flashing - Searching for protocol On - OBD protocol found. Short off indicates activity.

Parameter.name: Driver Fatigue Maximum Time Above Speed Threshold
Parameter.Help: Driver Fatigue Maximum Time Above Speed Threshold in Minutes
Parameter.Notes: This is the maximum time (minutes) a driver is allowed to spend above a configured speed threshold before a mandatory rest period is needed.

Parameter.name: Driver Fatigue Minimum Rest Period
Parameter.Help: Driver Fatigue Minimum Rest Period in minutes
Parameter.Notes: This parameter specifies the minimum time (minutes) a driver has to rest before he is allowed to drive again.

Parameter.name: Driver Fatigue Speed Threshold
Parameter.Help: Driver Fatigue Speed Threshold
Parameter.Notes: The Driver Fatigue Speed Threshold is the speed above which the unit will accumulate time spent above this threshold.

Parameter.name: Enable Driver Fatigue Module
Parameter.Help: Enable the Driver Fatigue Management and Reporting module
Parameter.Notes: This parameter will Enable the Driver Fatigue Management and Reporting module which monitors the drivers time at a speed above a certain threshold and reminds him through the use of a beeper to stop for a minimum configurable time. If the driver does not stop for the minimum time a violation event will be raised and reported.

Parameter.name: CS905 Driver Key Used
Parameter.Help: CS905 Driver Key Used via SoftUart
Parameter.Notes: In order to maintain compatibility with fleets that use existing CS905 type driver keys, the MHub has the ability to read these older type of keys. If these old keys are to be used with the MHub, this parameter must be enabled.

Parameter.name: CS905 Master Key Used
Parameter.Help: CS905 Master Key 0: Not Used 1: Used
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: Customer Code

Parameter.Notes: If this feature is enabled, only keys containing the same code as written to this parameter will allow access to the vehicle.

Parameter.Notes: If the driver key is intended to control the immobiliser connection to the vehicle, then this parameter must be set to 1 alternatively if there is no Driver Key used then the Output Follows Ignition Parameter or Bit in the Output A and B can be set to still be able to control immobilisation of the vehicle via the Disablement command.

Parameter.name: Enable Custom Driver Key Authorisation
Parameter.Help: Enables a custom device to send through Driver ID data
Parameter.Notes: Enables a custom device to send through Driver ID data

Parameter.name: Enable Driver Key
Parameter.Help: Driver Key Used
Parameter.Notes: If the driver key is used, then this parameter must be set to 1

Parameter.name: Enable PDA Driver Key Authorisation
Parameter.Help: Enables the PDA to send through Driver ID data
Parameter.Notes: Enables the PDA to send through Driver ID data

Parameter.name: Extended Driver ID
Parameter.Help: If this parameter is set then the driver ID is defined as 5 bytes and the Class and Fleet Code variables in the event is byte 3 - 5 of the driver ID
Parameter.Notes: If this parameter is set then the driver ID is defined as 5 bytes and the Class and Fleet Code variables in the event is byte 3 - 5 of the driver ID. The full driver ID is then: [Class][Fleet Code (2 bytes)][Driver ID (2 bytes)]

Parameter.name: Fleet Code
Parameter.Help: Fleet code assigned to the MHub
Parameter.Notes: The fleet code is a value between 0 and 65535 that is used for driver key comparison. The driver key is also programmed with a fleet code, and the fleet code and the driver key must match the fleet code on the MHub (this Value) before the driver key can be authenticated.

Parameter.name: Post Trip Validity
Parameter.Help: Driver key time out after trip end
Parameter.Notes: This is relevant when a driver key is used, and linked to the immobilizer function of the MHub. A driver inserts a valid key, the output goes ON, the driver starts the vehicle and drives off. When the driver turns the ignition OFF, the output can remain on for a certain time, thus allowing the driver to start the vehicle again without having to reinsert the key. (this is particularly usefull if a driver is struggling to strat a vehicle). This parameter specified the length of time is seconds that the output will remain ON after the driver has turned Ignition OFF. The default value is 30 seconds.

Parameter.name: Pre Trip Validity
Parameter.Help: Driver key time out before trip start
Parameter.Notes: This is relevant when a driver key is used, and linked to the immobilizer function of the MHub. When the driver key is inserted, and the MHub authenticates it, it will turn the relevant output on for a certain time, whicle waiting for the ignition to be turned ON. If ignition is not turned on within the time indicated by this parameter, the output will be turned OFF, and the driver will then need to reinsert the key again before the vehcile can be driven. The value is in seconds and the default is 30 seconds

Parameter.name: Restrict to Unique Driver-ID Keys
Parameter.Help: Restricts the MHub to recognise Stand Alone Unique Driver ID Keys only.
Parameter.Notes: Restricts the MHub to recognise Stand Alone Unique Driver ID Keys only.

Parameter.name: TCO Driver ID
Parameter.Help: Tachograph Driver ID
Parameter.Notes:
Tachograph Driver ID. The TCO driver ID consists of 16 Characters of which up to 5 will be used to convert into a MHub Driver ID. Digits 10,11,12,13,14 (index 1 based) will be used with the following limitation: 01234 will be 1234 21234 will be 21234 34567 will be 34567 45768 will be 45768 But 81234 will be 1234 (so here the duplicate will be 1234, but we would have this duplicate with 4 digits in any case)
e.g. AB0123456 78901 23 78901 is greater than 65535 so only digits 8901 will be used 78901 will be 8901

Parameter.name: Vehicle Class
Parameter.Help: Vehicle class the MHub is installed into
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: Verify Customer Code
Parameter.Help: Customer ID Used
Parameter.Notes: The driver key is programmed with a Customer Code, and the MHub is also programmed with a Customer Code. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to compare the Customer Code on the driver key to the Customer Code programmed on the MHub in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key. If this parameter is enabled, then the two Customer Code values need to match before the MHub will authenticate the driver key.

Parameter.name: Verify Driver Class
Parameter.Help: Driver Class Used
Parameter.Notes: The driver key is programmed with a class value, and the MHub is also programmed with a class value. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to use the class values in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key.

Parameter.name: Verify Driver ID
Parameter.Help: Custom Driver ID Used
Parameter.Notes: The driver key is programmed with a Driver ID value, and the MHub is also programmed with a list of DRiver ID values. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to compare the Driver ID on the driver key to any of the Driver ID values programmed on the MHub in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key. This means that for the driver key to authenticate, the specific driver ID programmed onto that driver key must have been programmed into the MHub already.

Parameter.name: Verify Fleet Code
Parameter.Help: Driver Fleet Used
Parameter.Notes: The driver key is programmed with a Driver Fleet value, and the MHub is also programmed with a Driver Fleet value. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to compare the Driver Fleet on the driver key to the Driver Fleet value programmed on the MHub in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key. If this parameter is set to 1, then the two driver fleet values need to match before the MHub will authenticate the driver key.

Parameter.name: General Purpose IO
Parameter.Help: General Purpose IO Event Configuration
Parameter.Notes:
Events can be configured to be high priority as well as what policy to use for sending it and what optional fields to include in the event report. The policy specify what mediums are allowed for communications and are configured in the "Communications" section.
This parameter is a bitfield where the bits have the following meanings:
Configuration = Bits 1,2,3 [0-7] : Policy, value between 0 and 7 Bit 4 : Not Used Bit 5 [16] : Include Location Optional Field Bit 6 [32] : Include Status Optional Field Bit 7 [64] : Event is High Priority Bit 8 [128] : Event is Enabled
How is this value calculated: As an example, configure the event to use policy 5, Include the Location Field, Include the Status Field and is enabled. Use the values in square brackets for each item and add them together, i.e. 5 + 16 + 32 + 128 = 181

Parameter.name: Enable Forced Default Triggers
Parameter.Help: Enable Forced Default Triggers
Parameter.Notes: This is a bit field of length 64 bits where each bit can switch a default forced trigger ON or OFF. If the corresponding bit is 0 then the trigger is not scanned else it is scanned. The bytes are numbered from left to right and the bits inside each byte from right to left which means if you want to disable the second trigger you would set this value to: FDFFFFFFFFFFFFFF

Parameter.name: Enable Index Forced Default Triggers
Parameter.Help: Enable and disable default index forced event triggers
Parameter.Notes: This is a bit field of length 64 bits where each bit can switch a default index forced trigger ON or OFF. If the corresponding bit is 0 then the trigger is not scanned else it is scanned. The bytes are numbered from left to right and the bits inside each byte from right to left which means if you want to disable the second trigger you would set this value to: FDFFFFFFFFFFFFFF

Parameter.name: Enable Scanned Default Triggers
Parameter.Help: Enable and disable default scanned event triggers
Parameter.Notes: This is a bit field of length 64 bits where each bit can switch a default scanned trigger ON or OFF. If the corresponding bit is 0 then the trigger is not scanned else it is scanned. The bytes are numbered from left to right and the bits inside each byte from right to left which means if you want to disable the second trigger you would set this value to: FDFFFFFFFFFFFFFF

Parameter.name: Include Trigger ID
Parameter.Help: Include the Trigger ID in event reports so that the trigger responsible for the event can be identified
Parameter.Notes: When an event is sent by the MHub, that event can be configured to include the Trigger ID of the trigger that caused the event. If this parameter is set to 1, then all events transmitted will include the trigger ID.

Parameter.name: Fuel Theft Threshold
Parameter.Help: Fuel Theft Threshold
Parameter.Notes:
Fuel Theft Threshold in percentage. If the trip start fuel is lower than the trip end fuel by this percentage, an event will be raised. A value of 0 and greater than 100 will disable this feature.
1 unit = 1 percentage point

Parameter.name: Fuel Type
Parameter.Help: Air Fuel Stoichometric ratio settings used in MAF fuel usage calculation 1 Petrol / Gasoline (AFR = 14.7 and Fuel Density = 715g/L) 2 Diesel (AFR = 14.5 and Fuel Density = 830g/L)
Parameter.Notes: Air Fuel Stoichometric ratio settings used in MAF fuel usage calculation 1 Petrol / Gasoline (AFR = 14.7 and Fuel Density = 715g/L) 2 Diesel (AFR = 14.5 and Fuel Density = 830g/L)

Parameter.name: In fuel flow meter volume per pulse
Parameter.Help: This is the amount of fuel the fuel flow meter connected to the inflow connection of the fuel tank will measure per pulse. The value should be expressed in micro liters. This Fuel Flow Meter should be connected to INPUT 2
Parameter.Notes: This is the amount of fuel the fuel flow meter connected to the inflow connection of the fuel tank will measure per pulse. The value should be expressed in micro liters. This is usually just for diesel engines as unused fuel flow back into the tank. This Fuel Flow Meter should be connected to INPUT 2

Parameter.name: Minimum Fuel Level
Parameter.Help: Level of fuel in the tank at which the Fuel Data event should be sent.
Parameter.Notes: Level of fuel in the tank at which the Fuel Data event should be sent. Setting it 0 would disable this functionality.

Parameter.name: Out fuel flow meter volume per pulse
Parameter.Help: This is the amount of fuel the fuel flow meter connected to the outflow connection of the fuel tank will measure per pulse. The value should be expressed in micro liters. This Fuel Flow Meter should be connected to INPUT 1.
Parameter.Notes: This is the amount of fuel the fuel flow meter connected to the outflow connection of the fuel tank will measure per pulse. The value should be expressed in micro liters. This Fuel Flow Meter should be connected to INPUT 1

Parameter.name: Report Fuel Level in Liters
Parameter.Help: Report fuel level in Liters in stead of percentage. The Fuel Tank size need to specified in the "Fuel Tank Capacity" parameter.
Parameter.Notes: Report fuel level in Liters in stead of percentage. The Fuel Tank size need to specified in the "Fuel Tank Capacity" parameter.

Parameter.name: Geofence Entry and Exit debounce
Parameter.Help: Geofence Entry and Exit debounce ensure that travelling on the boundary of the geofence does not cause exsessive entry and exit events
Parameter.Notes: This value is used to specify the amount of time in seconds that a vehicle must be constantly in or out of a geofence before the event is generated. The reason for this is that if the vehcile is travelling directly on the border of a geofence, due to the bounce of the GPS location, the MHub may calculate the unit to be bouncing in annd out of the geofence. The entry and exit events must only be generated when the vehicle is definitely entered or exited the geofence.

Parameter.name: Geofence Scanning Enabled
Parameter.Help: Geofence Scanning enabled or not
Parameter.Notes: If the geofence functionality of the MHub is to be used, this parameter must be set to 1 to enable the scanning of the geofences.

Parameter.name: Geofence Speed Warning Level
Parameter.Help: The speed below the geofence speed limit at which point the Geofence Speed Warning flag will be activated
Parameter.Notes: The speed below the geofence speed limit at which point the Geofence Speed Warning flag will be activated. The value is specified as a delta value, e.g. 5 means set the warning flag 5 km/h below the actual speed limit in the geofence

Parameter.name: Enable Geoloc Functionality
Parameter.Help: Switch the Geoloc functionality ON and OFF
Parameter.Notes: Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Geoloc functionality

Parameter.name: Geoloc Debounce Time
Parameter.Help: Time the unit need to be outside the geoloc before a breach is triggered
Parameter.Notes: This is the time inseconds that the MHub needs to be outisde of the geoloc geofence before the Geoloc Breach event will be triggered.

Parameter.name: Geoloc lift threshold
Parameter.Help: Geoloc lift threshold
Parameter.Notes: Geoloc lift threshold G-Force, 0.1g to 2.0g ng = N x 0.02 0.02g = 1 x 0.02 0.20g = 10 x 0.02 (default for 11.53degrees tilt) 1g = 50 2g = 100 Value of 0 Disables Geoloc lift detection

Parameter.name: Geoloc Radius
Parameter.Help: Geoloc Radius
Parameter.Notes: When the geoloc geofence is automatically created around the current location of the MHub, this parameter specifies the radius of that geofence as a difference between two latitude and longitude values.

Parameter.name: Geoloc Recovery Mode
Parameter.Help: Enable Geoloc Recovery Mode
Parameter.Notes: When Geoloc Recovery Mode is enabled and the Geoloc is Breached, Active Recovery mode is enabled. A Recovery Message is then sent every 30 seconds for 2 hours.

Parameter.name: Geoloc Tow Away Arming Delay
Parameter.Notes: Geoloc Tow Away Arming Delay

Parameter.name: Geoloc Tow Away Arming Movement Lockout
Parameter.Help: Geoloc Tow Away Arming Movement Lockout
Parameter.Notes: Geoloc Tow Away Acc Noise Delay. The Geoloc Tow Away Arming will only occur if no movement is detected and after the Geoloc Tow Away Arming delay has expired.

Parameter.name: Geoloc Tow Away Enable
Parameter.Help: Geoloc Tow Away Enable
Parameter.Notes: Geoloc Tow Away uses accelerometer to detect vehicle being lifted. Threshold set via Geoloc lift threshold.

Parameter.name: Geoloc Tow Away Trigger Delay
Parameter.Help: Geoloc Tow Away Trigger Delay
Parameter.Notes: Geoloc Tow Away Trigger Delay in seconds. When the MHub detects a tamper it will wait for the Geoloc Tow Away Trigger Delay before generating the event. This allows for a window to disable the geoloc tamper by starting the vehicle.

Parameter.name: Geoloc Trip End Enable
Parameter.Help: Enable Geoloc Trip End
Parameter.Notes: Enable the creation of a Geoloc, for current location, at Trip End. Geoloc will be disabled after ignition on

Parameter.name: GSM Tower Geo-Lock Enable
Parameter.Help: Uses visible GSM towers to determine if a MHub has been moved. NB The MHub will have to move a considerable distance before a Geolock breach will be detected.
Parameter.Notes: Uses visible GSM towers to determine if a MHub has been moved. NB The MHub will have to move a considerable distance before a Geolock breach will be detected.

Parameter.name: GSM Tower Geo-Lock Perimeter Depth
Parameter.Help: This parameter indicates how far down the list of neighbouring towers the Original serving cell may appear before it is taken that the geoloc has been breached. 0 - If the original serving cell has changed then the Geoloc will be considered breached. (Not recommended) 1 - The Serving cell and the next strongest cell will be checked. If neither of these are the Original serving cell then the geoloc will be considered breached 2 - Serving cell and 2 strongest neighbouring cells will be checked ... 6 - Serving cell and all neighbouring cells will be checked.
Parameter.Notes: This parameter indicates how far down the list of neighbouring towers the Original serving cell may appear before it is taken that the geoloc has been breached. 0 - If the original serving cell has changed then the Geoloc will be considered breached. (Not recommended) 1 - The Serving cell and the next strongest cell will be checked. If neither of these are the Original serving cell then the geoloc will be considered breached 2 - Serving cell and 2 strongest neighbouring cells will be checked ... 6 - Serving cell and all neighbouring cells will be checked.

Parameter.Help: Time in seconds that the unit will wait until determining that the unit has left the area.
Parameter.Notes: Time in seconds that the unit will wait until determining that the unit has left the area.

Parameter.name: Disable GPS Speed Accuracy Filter
Parameter.Help: Disable GPS Speed Accuracy Filter
Parameter.Notes:
Disable GPS Speed Accuracy Filter.
GPS Speed Accuracy Filter will require the current GPS Speed to be greater than the current GPS Speed Accuracy measure to be used in calculations and events.

Parameter.name: Enable BeiDou
Parameter.Help: Enable BeiDou
Parameter.Notes: Enable BeiDou with GPS

Parameter.name: Enable Glonass
Parameter.Help: Enable Glonass with GPS
Parameter.Notes: Enable Glonass with GPS

Parameter.name: Enable GPS AssistNow Autonomous
Parameter.Help: Enable GPS AssistNow Autonomous
Parameter.Notes: Enable GPS AssistNow Autonomous AssistNow Autonomous can provide quicker start-up times (lower the TTFF) provided that data is available for enough visible satellites. This is particularly true under weak signal conditions where it might not be possible to download broadcast ephemerides at all, and, therefore, no fix at all would be possible without AssistNow Autonomous (or A-GPS). The AssistNow Autonomous orbit (satellite position) accuracy depends on various factors, such as the particular type of satellite vehicle, the accuracy of the underlying broadcast ephemeris, or the orbital phase of the satellite and Earth, and the age of the data (errors add up over time). The positioning accuracy depends on various factors, such as the satellite position accuracy, the number of visible satellites, and the geometry (DOP) of the visible satellites. Position fixes that include AssistNow Autonomous orbit information may be significantly worse than fixes using only broadcast ephemerides.

Parameter.name: Enable GPS Default Config
Parameter.Help: Enable GPS Default Config
Parameter.Notes: Use to not change factory configuration of GPS except for enabling GPS Messages.

Parameter.name: Enable GPS FixNow Mode

Parameter.name: Enable GPS FixNow Mode in Sleep
Parameter.Help: Enable GPS FixNow Mode in Sleep
Parameter.Notes: Enable GPS FixNow Mode in Sleep will have the GPS powered in sleep mode until Power Mode time to Deep Sleep has elapsed.

If the gps position accuracy is not better than the threshold e.g. lower value, then gps w ill not be used in calculation. For example not to do geofence checks if the GPS accuracy radius is larger than the geofence radius.

Parameter.Notes: Sends input 8 on/off event when GPS antenna is connected/disconnected

Parameter.Help: 0 - Internal Antenna, 1 - Auto Antenna, 2 External Antenna
Parameter.Notes: 0 - Internal Antenna, 1 - Auto Antenna, 2 External Antenna

Parameter.name: GPS Coordinate Distance
Parameter.Help: Calculate distance from GPS coordinates.
Parameter.Notes: If GPS speed is used to calculate trip distance, the accuracy of trip distance will be negatively affected when GPS lock is lost. By adding the distance between the last known position and position where GPS lock was obtained again, this error can be reduced.

Parameter.name: GPS Hardware Reset
Parameter.Help: Enable GPS Hardware Reset
Parameter.Notes: If this bit is set the unit may power-cycle to try and recover GPS lock

Parameter.name: GPS Hardware Reset Time-Out
Parameter.Help: GPS Hardware Reset Time-Out
Parameter.Notes: GPS Hardware Reset Time-Out is the delay after a trip start after which it will power cycle the unit in case no GPS lock was acquired. This will recover the GPS in case of a GPS Module Lock-up. Minimum Time is checked and forced to 600seconds in code in case it is configured to a lower value.

Parameter.name: GPS Max Speed Filter
Parameter.Help: GPS Max Speed Filter
Parameter.Notes:
GPS Max Speed Filter for populating Trip Max Speed. 0 Disable. Always Populate 206-255 Disable. Always Populate
GPS Speed Accuracy Threshold 1-100 GPS Speed Accuracy threshold in kmph. Will only use speed when GPS Speed Accuracy is equal or less than threshold
1st Order Low Pass Filter 201 GPS Speed Low Pass Filter value to populate Max Speed, 1 over minimum speeding time coefficient 202 GPS Speed Low Pass Filter value to populate Max Speed, 0.1000 coefficient 203 GPS Speed Low Pass Filter value to populate Max Speed, 0.0166 coefficient
Reduce Speed by GPS Speed Accuracy 204 Use (Speed - Speed Accuracy) e.g. floor to populate Max Speed
GPS Position Accuracy Filter combined with minimum satellite count 205 Only populate Max Speed if Satellite count 6+ and Position Accuracy 1-5m

Include position accuracy and position source in each event

Parameter.Notes: Distance in meters from Last Valid position up to which the last valid position is still considered valid

Parameter.name: Last Position Time Threshold
Parameter.Help: Maximum age of the Last Valid position while a trip is in progress before the position is considered invalid and no longer used in events.

Parameter.name: Ignition Source: Speed
Parameter.Help: Ignition Source: Speed
Parameter.Notes: One more possible source of ignition is to use Speed. If Speed is greater than the value specified in parameter "Ignition Source from RPM Threshold", the vehicle is moving. If speed is to be used as ignition, this parameter is set to 1.

Parameter.name: Disable Speed Threshold
Parameter.Help: This value indicate the maximum speed threshold at which point it is safe to disable a vehicle
Parameter.Notes: The MHub has the ability to be connect to the vehicle in such a way that it is possible to immobilize the vehicle. The recommended way to connect into the vehcile for driver key and immobilizer usage is to connect to the starter motor of the vehicle. This will prevent the vehicle from being started unless a valid driver key is used. However it is also possible to connect the MHub in such a way that it will interrupt the ignition signal to the rest of the vehicle. This will also prevent the vehicle from being started unless a valid driver key is used, but this will also allow the vehcile to be immobilized and the engine turned OFF at any time. In order to provide some safety in this scenario, this parameter specifies a minimum speed, above which the vehcile will not be immobilized, even if instructed to do so.

Parameter.name: Global Vehicle Disablement Allowed
Parameter.Help: Global Vehicle Disablement Allowed
Parameter.Notes: if the Global Vehicle Disablement Allowed bit is set, a command can remotely disable the vehicle overriding the Driver Key.

Parameter.name: Vehicle Disablement Delay
Parameter.Help: Vehicle Disablement Delay
Parameter.Notes: Vehicle Disablement Delay from request to vehicle disabled in seconds.

Parameter.name: Vehicle Idle Immobilise Time-Out
Parameter.Help: Vehicle Idle Immobilise Time-Out
Parameter.Notes: Vehicle Idle Immobilise Time-Out in seconds it the period before vehicle will be immobilised. Value of 0 disables this feature. Minimum time is 300s or 5 minutes.

Parameter.name: Vehicle Immobilise if Idle
Parameter.Help: Vehicle Immobilise if Idle
Parameter.Notes: If enabled the Vehicle will Immobilise if Idle time-out period is reached

Parameter.name: Insurance Daily Event Time
Parameter.Help: Insurance Daily Event Time
Parameter.Notes: The Insurance Daily Event Time parameter is the time in minutes from 00:00 UTC that the Event will be generated and daily Insurance parameters cleared. e.g. 02:30am(UTC) value should be 150 11:00pm(UTC) value should be 1380

Parameter.name: Emergency Mode Periodic Position Interval
Parameter.Help: Periodic Position Interval when the unit is in Emergency Mode - in seconds
Parameter.Notes: This is where an emergency event is sent to the MHub to place it into an Emergency mode. In this mode this parameter specifies the time interval in seconds that periodic positions will be sent.

Parameter.name: Enable Test Event
Parameter.Help: ABSOLETE: Enable Test Event
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Not used

Parameter.name: Force Wakeup Event Timeout
Parameter.Help: This is the time in seconds before forcing the unit to send the Wakeup event even when it does not have a 3D GPS lock
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub802 wakes up, one of its tasks is to get a 3D GPS lock as quickly as possible. However it may be that it is impossible for the MHub802 to get a GPS location at all. To prevent the MHub802 from staying ON for too long and thus reducing the battery life, this parameter specifies a maximum time in seconds that the MHub802 will wait for a 3D GPS lock. If a lock is not achieved after waiting this amount of time, the event will be sent in anyway, indicating that the GPS lock wan not valid.

Parameter.name: Geoloc Breach Periodic Position
Parameter.Help: Periodic Positions for when the geoloc has been breached - in seconds
Parameter.Notes: The Mhub802 has geoloc functionality, whereby a command is sent to the MHub802 that will cause it to create a geofence around its current location. Every time the MHub802 wakes up, the location is checked to see if it is still inside this geoloc geofence. If it is outside of the geofence, the MHub802 will enter an Alarm mode and will send periodic locations at the interval specified by this parameter in seconds.

Parameter.name: Maximum ON Time
Parameter.Help: Maximum time in seconds the unit should stay ON when something causes any of the logic not to work out
Parameter.Notes: This parameter specifies the maximum time that the MHub802 will remain on under normal operating instances. So if both GSM and GPS are OK, but the MHub cannot send the SMS, or has too many sms's to send, it will turn OFF after this time.

Parameter.name: Maximum ON Time with Ignition
Parameter.Help: Maximum on time in seconds with ignition on
Parameter.Notes:
XXX - Change this to tamper instead of ignition
The Mhub802 can be mounted with a tamper detection in place so that if it is removed from its mounting place, it will wake up immediately. This operation is outside of the noemal operation of the MHub802. When the tamper it triggered, this parameter specifies for how long the MHub801 will remain on before turning OFF again. Note that it the tamper detection is still triggererd by the time the MHub is supposed to turn OFF again, it will not turn OFF.

Parameter.name: RTC Offset Type
Parameter.Help: _X: RTC Time Offset from 00:00 X_: RTC Periodic Offset from current time XX: RTC HH:MM Offset from 00:00
Parameter.Notes: The operation of the MHub802 is such that it wakes up, send a message and switches off again. 1(01 old) = RTC Time Offset. This tells the MHub that the value stored in the Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time are minute intervals from 12:00 midnight at which to wake up. e.g. Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time = 360, unit will wake up 06:00, 12:00, 18:00 and 00:00 2(10 old) = RTC Periodic Offset. This tells the MHub that the value stored in the Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time are minutes from the current time at which to wake up again. Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time = 360, if the current time is 13:09 the next wake up time will be 19:09 3(11 old) = RTC HH:MM Offset. There are 4 parameters that are used to specify the time that the MHub802 must wake up. This parameter specifies how these 4 time parameters are interpreted by the MHub802. The 4 time parameters are RTC Wake-Up Time 0 to 3 and entered in minutes.

Parameter.name: RTC Wake-Up Time 0
Parameter.Help: RTC Wake-Up Time 0 in Minutes from 00:00
Parameter.Notes: This is one of the 4 times that are used to specify at what time the MHub802 will wake up. IT is minutes taken from midnight GMT (UTC)

Parameter.name: RTC Wake-Up Time 1
Parameter.Help: RTC Wake-Up Time 1 in Minutes from 00:00
Parameter.Notes: See RTC Wake-UP Time 0

Parameter.name: RTC Wake-Up Time 2
Parameter.Help: RTC Wake-Up Time 2 in Minutes from 00:00
Parameter.Notes: See RTC Wake-UP Time 0

Parameter.name: RTC Wake-Up Time 3
Parameter.Help: RTC Wake-Up Time 3 in Minutes from 00:00
Parameter.Notes: See RTC Wake-UP Time 0

Parameter.name: Sealed Unit Enable
Parameter.Help: This indicates if the MHub is a sealed unit or not.
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub is an 802 unit. This parameter is set, that enables specific MHub802 functioality - XXX change this to MHub802 mode. Let's stop calling it sealed unit.

Parameter.name: Sealed Unit GPS off after lock
Parameter.Help: If set GPS goes to low power mode after 3D lock
Parameter.Notes: The principle behind the long battery life of the MHub802 is that it perform its required functions as quickly as possible, and then turn off again. When the MHub802 turn ON, it needs to register on the GSM network, wait for a GPS position to be computed, send the SMS and then shut down again. If a GPS position is attained before the GSM network registration is achieved, it makes no real sense to keep the GPS on. However one the MHub has a valid GPS lock, remaining ON may actually improve the accuracy of that position somewhat. However in most instances the initial 3D lock is acceptable. This parameter specifies that the GPS must turn OFF immedaitely after getting a 3D lock. If set to 1, the GPS will trun OFF immediately after a 3D lock

Parameter.name: Sealed Unit RTC wake-up time
Parameter.Help: Sealed Unit RTC wake-up time in Minutes
Parameter.Notes: This is the timer that is used with the mode is set to XXX. Time is in minutes - Really should write somehting better here

Parameter.name: Tamper Mode Periodic Position Interval
Parameter.Help: Periodic Position Interval for when the unit is in Tamper Mode - in seconds
Parameter.Notes: The tamper mode described in XXX will also result in the MHub802 sending periodic location events. This parameter specifies the interval at which the MHub802 will send periodic events while in Tamper mode.

Parameter.name: Time on after event sent
Parameter.Help: This is the time in seconds the unit should stay ON after the wakeup event was sent
Parameter.Notes:
XXX - What wakeup event.
After the MHub802 has sent the event, it is possible that there may have been a message that has been sent to the MHub802. And thus some time needs to be allowed to be able to recieve that event. This parameter specifies the time in seconds that the MHUb802 will remain ON after the event has been sent.

Parameter.name: Time to wait for GPS Lock
Parameter.Help: Time in seconds to wait for a good GPS Lock
Parameter.Notes: This is the maximum time in seconds that the MHub will wait to get a GPS position, if it does not have a valid position at the end of this time, the MHub will turn off.

Parameter.name: Time to wait for GSM coverage
Parameter.Help: Time in seconds to wait for GSM Network coverage
Parameter.Notes: This is the maximum time in seconds that the MHub will wait to register onto the GSM network, if it does not register onto the network by the end of this time, it will turn off.

This parameter allows the unit to accept and act on Telit Modem firmware upgrades. If this bit is enabled the Telit modem will be taken offline and upgraded. This should be kept disabled until needed.

Parameter.name: Modem Power Down Recovery Interval
Parameter.Help: Minimum amount of time that will elapse between Modem Power Down Recovery attemtps. Note that this time is counted while the MHub is awake. Sleep time is not counted.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Minimum amount of time that will elapse between Modem Power Down Recovery attemtps. Note that this time is counted while the MHub is awake. Sleep time is not counted.

Parameter.name: Modem Power Down Recovery Standoff Time
Parameter.Help: If the modem is unable to establish an APN session within the allowed attempts then it will power itself down for the configured number of minutes. The frequency with which this can occur is governed by the Modem Power Down Recovery Interval parameter. Setting this to 0 disables this feature.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
If the modem is unable to establish an APN session within the allowed attempts then it will power itself down for the configured number of minutes. The frequency with which this can occur is governed by the Modem Power Down Recovery Interval parameter. Setting this to 0 disables this feature.

Parameter.name: Net Info Check Period
Parameter.Help: Number of seconds between checking net information during maintenance cycles
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: Network Survey Period
Parameter.Help: The amount of seconds that must pass in between the the unit updating its records of surrounding GSM Cell tower info.
Parameter.Notes: The amount of seconds that must pass in between the the unit updating its records of surrounding GSM Cell tower info.

Parameter.name: No Network with Signal Timeout
Parameter.Help: If the modem detects a CREG of 2 but has a good CSQ reading i.e >10 for this number of seconds then is performs a network deregistration and re-registration.
Parameter.Notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

Parameter.name: Selection of Preferred PLMN List
Parameter.Help: Used to select the list of the preferred PLMN list in the SIM/USIM. Please consult tech support as to the correct setting for your GSM service provider. Default is 0. (User controlled PLMN selection)
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Used to select the list of the preferred PLMN list in the SIM/USIM. Please consult tech support as to the correct setting for your GSM service provider. Default is 0. (User controlled PLMN selection)

None

Parameter.name: SMS Check Period

Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: Tx Power Channel 0
Parameter.Help: Range +-20 with 128 offset. Each count equates to 0.25dB gain. Negative value increases power. Positive value decreases power. E.g. 0 = No effect. Command is skipped 128 = 0 (no Tx power change) 127 = -1 (increase power by 0.25dBm 130 = 2 (decrease power by 0.5 dBm)
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Range +-20 with 128 offset. Each count equates to 0.25dB gain. Negative value increases power. Positive value decreases power. E.g. 0 = No effect. Command is skipped 128 = 0 (no Tx power change) 127 = -1 (increase power by 0.25dBm 130 = 2 (decrease power by 0.5 dBm)

Parameter.name: Tx Power Channel 1
Parameter.Help: ALTERING THIS VALUE MAY VOID YOUR WARRANTY Range +-20 with 128 offset. Each count equates to 0.25dB gain. Negative value increases power. Positive value decreases power. E.g. 0 = No effect. Command is skipped 128 = 0 (no Tx power change) 127 = -1 (increase power by 0.25dBm 130 = 2 (decrease power by 0.5 dBm)
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
ALTERING THIS VALUE MAY VOID YOUR WARRANTY Range +-20 with 128 offset. Each count equates to 0.25dB gain. Negative value increases power. Positive value decreases power. E.g. 0 = No effect. Command is skipped 128 = 0 (no Tx power change) 127 = -1 (increase power by 0.25dBm 130 = 2 (decrease power by 0.5 dBm)

Parameter.name: Access Point Node (APN Name)
Parameter.Help: Access Point Node identifier e.g. internet
Parameter.Notes: The APN (Access Point Node) is used when the Mhub will use GPRS to communicate with MProfiler. The GSM service provider will specify what APN Name should be used. A commonly used public APN is "internet" however not all networks will use this.

Parameter.name: Allow APN Standoff Cancellation from Tower change
Parameter.Help: Allows a tower change to clear network error from too many failed APN activation attempts.
Parameter.Notes: Allows a tower change to clear network error from too many failed APN activation attempts.

Parameter.name: APN Password
Parameter.Help: GSM Network supplied APN Password
Parameter.Notes: If the MHub is configured to communicate over GPRS, it needs to attach to the APN of the GSM service provider in order to communicate over GPRS. In some instances a GSM service provider may require that the MHub use a passoword when connecting to the APN. If no passowrd is required, this parameter can be left blank.

Parameter.name: APN User Name
Parameter.Help: GSM Network supplied APN User Name
Parameter.Notes: If the MHub is configured to communicate over GPRS, it needs to attach to the APN of the GSM service provider in order to communicate over GPRS. In some instances a GSM service provider may require that the MHub use a username when connecting to the APN. If no username is required, this parameter can be left blank.

Parameter.name: GPRS Class Configuration
Parameter.Help: Sets the GPRS class of the modem. 0 - Do not set; 1 - Set to Class B; 2 - Set to class CG; 3 - Set to class CC
Parameter.Notes: This paramete allows for the setting of the GPRS Class of the Modem. In most instances the Mhub should never have to change the class of the modem, however it is possible for a GSM network to change the class of the modem, then the MHub may need to change it back. The value of this parameter defines to what class type the MHub will set the mode: 00 - MHub will not set the Modem Class 01 - MHub will set the modem to Class B 02 - Mhub will set the modem to Class CG 03 - MHub will set the Modem to Class CC For correct opetation of the MHUb, the modem should be set to class XXX

Parameter.name: Stack Start Retry Delay
Parameter.Help: Period of Stack Start retries.
Parameter.Notes: If the stack fails to connect to the APN it needs to be restarted. The amount of time in between restarts should be enough to allow the unit time to read any incoming SMS's that may contain new APN information that will allow a successful connection.

Parameter.name: GSM Network Selection Mode
Parameter.Help: Refer to AT Command Specification. Do Not set to 3 as this will break the modem when roaming.
Parameter.Notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

Parameter.name: Preferred Operator Selection
Parameter.Help: Enables preferred operator selection. Make sure that the operator SIM supports this before enabling. Do not enable for PTCRB.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
ATnT do not allow this setting. Check that the operator allows this.

Parameter.name: Roaming Operator 1
Parameter.Help: Preferred Roaming Operator 1
Parameter.Notes: When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available.

Parameter.name: Roaming Operator 2
Parameter.Help: Preferred Roaming Operator 2
Parameter.Notes: When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available.

Parameter.name: Roaming Operator 3
Parameter.Help: Preferred Roaming Operator 3
Parameter.Notes: When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available.

Parameter.name: Roaming Operator 4
Parameter.Help: Preferred Roaming Operator 4
Parameter.Notes: When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available.

Parameter.name: See Roaming Operator as Home Enable
Parameter.Help: If enabled registration on selected operator networks when roaming will be treated as home network registration allowing normal event reporting.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
In order to provide flexibility in costing of data transmission using both GPRS and SMS over roaming networks, the MHub has the ability to send certain events only when the MHub is in a local network for instance, and not if it is roaming. However, there may be instances where if a MHub roams on a specific "partner" network, that the data costs are similar to those of the local network. So in order to facilitate this, the MHub is able to regard a certain roaming network as actually being a "Home" netwotk. Enabling this parameter will enable the ability of the Mhub to see a roaming netwotk as a Home network, and apply the Home network data transmission rules.

Parameter.name: Cell Towers to Use
Parameter.Help: The number of Cells to use. Note that this denotes a maximum. The actual number depends on the quality of signal from adjacent towers. 0 Disables Gsm positioning.
Parameter.Notes: The number of Cells to use. Note that this denotes a maximum. The actual number depends on the quality of signal from adjacent towers. 0 - Disables Gsm positioning.

Parameter.name: Position Frequency Limit
Parameter.Help: 0 - Limit off >30 - Number of seconds before a successive GSM position request is carried out. Any set value below 30 seconds is taken as 30 seconds.
Parameter.Notes: 0 - Limit off >30 - Number of seconds before a successive GSM position request is carried out. Any set value below 30 seconds is taken as 30 seconds.

Parameter.name: Provider License
Parameter.Help: Gsm Positioning License Provider
Parameter.Notes: Gsm Positioning License Provider

Parameter.name: Telit Location Mode
Parameter.Help: Mode of operation: 0 - Not operational 1 - Get position at start-up if Best guess is not available.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Mode of operation: 0 - Not operational 1 - Get position at start-up if Best guess is not available.

Parameter.name: Telit Position Expiry Time
Parameter.Help: The number of minutes that a location retrieved from the Telit location platform will be considered valid i.e. the maximum position age
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The number of minutes that a location retrieved from the Telit location platform will be considered valid. i.e. the maximum position age.

Parameter.name: Telit Position Query Block Time
Parameter.Help: Minimum amount of time between Telit Position requests. It is highly recommended that this be set at a value greater than 45 minutes.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Minimum amount of time between Telit Position requests. It is recommended that this be set at a value greater than 45 minutes.

Parameter.name: Time before GSM Positioning Active
Parameter.Help: This is the maximum age of a GPS position to when the unit begins requesting GSM positions
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This is the maximum age of a GPS position to when the unit begins requesting GSM positions

Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Forces the use of the Auxiliary IP address and port for the Telit Location Server.

Parameter.name: Auth List MSISDN 1
Parameter.Help: MSISDN of SIM cards that are allowed to send commands to the MHub. NOTE: Using short numbers (less than 9 digits) degrades the security provided by this feature.
Parameter.Notes: MSISDN of SIM cards that are allowed to send commands to the MHub. NOTE: Using short numbers (less than 9 digits) degrades the security provided by this feature.

Parameter.Notes: MSISDN of SIM cards that are allowed to send commands to the MHub. NOTE: Using short numbers (less than 9 digits) degrades the security provided by this feature.

Parameter.Notes: MSISDN of SIM cards that are allowed to send commands to the MHub. NOTE: Using short numbers (less than 9 digits) degrades the security provided by this feature.

Parameter.name: Ignore SIM Status for SMS operations
Parameter.Help: Ignores the QSS value before performing SMS operations.
Parameter.Notes: Ignores the QSS value before performing SMS operations.

Parameter.name: No voice cut on restart.
Parameter.Help: Ignores SMS errors during voice calls
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This caters for the situation where a socket is being torn down and a voice call is immediately made active followed by sending an SMS. This sometimes causes temporary network rejection of an SMS submission. This is normally temporary can be ignored.
The ATZ command is also skipped. The Default value used to be 0. It has now been changed to 1 as the ATZ can cause problems on the Telit modems.

Parameter.name: Normal SMS Sending
Parameter.Help: Allows selection of GPRS SMS or Circuit switched SMS. This should not be changed from the default value unless there are network reasons. If this is changed SMS\'s will not work if there is no GPRS !
Parameter.Notes: In some GSM networks, it is possible to send a SMS from the MHub making use of the GPRS mechanism. There is generally no difference in the cost of sending the SMS, however the SMS will be sent faster. This should really only be used if the MHub is configured in such a way that will require sending many SMS messages quickly in succession. The disadvantage of using the method of sending SMS's, is that if the MHub finds itself outside of GPRS coverage, it will not be able to send the SMS, whereas if this option is turned off, the MHub would be able to send the SMS.

Parameter.name: Service Centre Address (1)
Parameter.Help: Primary Service Centre Address
Parameter.Notes: When communicating over SMS, the Service Center Address is used, this can also be called SMSC, and will be provided by the GSM service provider.

Parameter.name: SMS 7 bit coding scheme
Parameter.Help: 7 bit SMS coding Scheme
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

Parameter.name: SMS 8 bit coding scheme

None

Parameter.name: SMS Destination Address
Parameter.Help: The destination address of the next sms to be sent. This excludes event report sms\'s

None

Parameter.name: SMS Message Retry
Parameter.Help: Number of times that an SMS must be retried
Parameter.Notes: The parameter specifies the number of times that a SMS message will be retried if a send fails, before the message is discarded. Note that although the SMS may be discarded - if it is an event SMS, the same SMS will be regenerated again - so events will never be discarded

Parameter.name: SMS Validity Period
Parameter.Help: Validity time of a sent SMS.
Parameter.Notes: Specifies the validity period that the SMS will wait to be delivered for. the default of 180 is about 1 week.

Parameter.name: Text Auth-List ONLY Enable
Parameter.Help: Enables Auth List ONLY security for Text SMS commands. Any MSISDN on the Auth list is always allowed.
Parameter.Notes: Enables Auth List ONLY security for Text SMS commands. Any MSISDN on the Auth list is always allowed.

Parameter.name: Scotch Call Enable
Parameter.Help: Enables the Scotch call control feature. NB: Remember to set up the Whitelist for the relevant MSISDNs. NB: Numbers in the Whitelist will not be able to call the unit using a voice call if this feature is enabled.

Parameter.name: Scotch Call Enable Safe Mode Control
Parameter.Help: Enables Safe Mode on/off toggling using the scotch call feature. Scotch call must be enabled.

Parameter.name: Scotch Call Enable Trip Type Control
Parameter.Help: Allows a trip type to be toggled between business and private. Scotch call must be enabled.

Parameter.name: GSM Jamming Debounce
Parameter.Help: The amount of seconds of Jamming before the de-bounced jamming flag is set.
Parameter.Notes: The amount of seconds of Jamming before the de-bounced jamming flag is set.

Parameter.name: HSDPA - CARRNUM
Parameter.Help: Set the minimum number of possible jammed carriers to consider that the module is under jamming condition.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Set the minimum number of possible jammed carriers to consider that the module is under jamming condition.

Parameter.name: HSDPA - P_EcN0_T3G
Parameter.Help: Set the threshold of EcN0 in 3G Network.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Set the threshold of EcN0 in 3G Network.

Parameter.name: HSDPA - P_RSCP_T3G

Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Set the threshold of RxLev in 2G Network

Parameter.name: HSDPA - SAT2G
Parameter.Help: Set the starting absolute threshold of RxLevel 2G Network. After a frequency scan in 2G bands, if the power measured of a carrier is above of SAT2G that carrier is counted as possible jammed carrier.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Set the starting absolute threshold of RxLevel 2G Network. After a frequency scan in 2G bands, if the power measured of a carrier is above of SAT2G that carrier is counted as possible jammed carrier.

Parameter.name: HSDPA - SAT3G

Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Set the starting absolute threshold of RSSI 3G Network. After a frequency scan in 3G bands, if the power measured of a carrier is above of SAT3G that carrier is counted as possible jammed carrier.
