Parameter.Help: Maximum Allowed Noise power level before jamming is assumed.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Maximum Allowed Noise power level before jamming is assumed.

Parameter.name: Jamming Detect Min Channel
Parameter.Help: Disturbed Channel Minimum Number (DCMN)
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Disturbed Channel Minimum Number (DCMN)

Parameter.name: Jamming Detect Notification Enable
Parameter.Help: 0 - GSM Jamming detection disabled 1 - GSM Jamming detection enabled. Flags set on detection of Jamming signal. 2 - As in (1) but event follows debounced flag 3 - As in (1) but event follows detection flag; i.e. event sent immediately on detection of GSM jamming. NB: This is a service provided by the network and not only dependant on configuration or abilities of the MHub.
Parameter.Notes: 0 - GSM Jamming detection disabled 1 - GSM Jamming detection enabled. Flags set on detection of Jamming signal. 2 - As in (1) but event follows debounced flag 3 - As in (1) but event follows detection flag; i.e. event sent immediately on detection of GSM jamming. NB: This is a service provided by the network and not only dependant on configuration or abilities of the MHub.

Parameter.name: Daily Clear of Forbidden PLMN List
Parameter.Help: If enabled the Forbidden PLMN list will be cleared on the first trip of the day.
Parameter.Notes: If enabled the Forbidden PLMN list will be cleared on the first trip of the day.

Parameter.name: Disable SIM PIN Safety
Parameter.Help: Set as below to disable SIM PIN protection features that prevent blocking a PIN 0 Pin protection enabled 1 Pin protection disabled but last attempt will be protected. 66 All pin protection disabled. NB: Setting this will cause a SIM card to be PUKed in the event the incorrect pin is entered.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Set as below to disable SIM PIN protection features that prevent blocking a PIN 0 Pin protection enabled 1 Pin protection disabled but last attempt will be protected. 66 All pin protection disabled. NB: Setting this will cause a SIM card to be PUKed in the event the incorrect pin is entered.

Parameter.name: Periodic Forbidden PLMN Clearing
Parameter.Help: If enabled on MHubs equipped with Telit modems are able to clear the Forbidden PLMN list periodically The period is hard coded to 60 minutes
Parameter.Notes: If enabled on MHubs equipped with Telit modems are able to clear the Forbidden PLMN list periodically The period is hard coded to 60 minutes

Parameter.name: PTCRB SIM Pre-Read Delay
Parameter.Help: The delay before the pin is used again. Necessary for PTCRB compliance.
Parameter.Notes: Setting this parameter invokes a delay before the unit reads the SIM card to prevent reads for sims of the incorrect voltage that are inserted. This must be set to 60 seconds for all units deployed in the USA

Parameter.name: SIM Commissioning Attempts
Parameter.Help: Number of SIM commissioning attempts before the unit stands off for a configurable period.
Parameter.Notes: Number of SIM commissioning attempts before the unit stands off for a configurable period. Setting this parameter to zero disables the stand-off feature.

Parameter.name: SIM Commissioning Enable
Parameter.Help: Enables SIM Specific Network Operations
Parameter.Notes: Enables SIM Specific Network Operations

Parameter.name: Sim Commissioning IVR Sequence Enable
Parameter.Help: Enables the IVR SIM Commissioning
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Enables the IVR SIM Commissioning

Parameter.name: SIM Commissioning Standoff Period
Parameter.Help: The number of seconds the SIM commissioning process must pause after a number of attempts to commission the SIM.
Parameter.Notes: The number of seconds the SIM commissioning process must pause after a number of attempts to commission the SIM.

Parameter.name: SIM Network Lock Enable
Parameter.Help: Restricts the use of SIMs to those conforming to a particular IMSI network ID specified in the SIM Network Lock Network ID parameter.
Parameter.Notes: Restricts the use of SIMs to those conforming to a particular IMSI network ID specified in the SIM Network Lock Network ID parameter.

Parameter.name: SIM Network Lock Network ID
Parameter.Help: First 5 digits of IMSI that identify the network whose SIM cards will be allowed to operate. Note that SIM commissioning enable and SIM Network lock must both be enabled for this to work.
Parameter.Notes: First 5 digits of IMSI that identify the network whose SIM cards will be allowed to operate. Note that SIM commissioning enable and SIM Network lock must both be enabled for this to work.

Parameter.name: Sim Operations Disable
Parameter.Help: Enabling this bit will disable certain operations relating to Sim Commissioning bit fields. The purpose of this bit is to prevent legacy configuration incorrectly enabling features.
Parameter.Notes: Enabling this bit will disable certain operations relating to Sim Commissioning bit fields. The purpose of this bit is to prevent legacy configuration incorrectly enabling features.

Parameter.name: SIM PIN
Parameter.Help: Sim PIN
Parameter.Notes: When a SIM card is used in the MHub that has a PIN which is not "0000", and the PIN Request on the SIM card is enabled, the value of that PIN is entered here. Great care must be taken to ensure that the PIN on the SIM matched the PIN programmed into this parameter. Faulure to ensure correct values here will result in the SIM being blocked, and then requiring the PUK.

Parameter.name: SIM PIN Last Used
Parameter.Help: This is the PIN that was last used when requested by the GSM modem. This is modified by the unit and should not be edited.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Scope

Parameter.name: SIM Toolkit Application Instance
Parameter.Help: Attaches SIM Toolkit to the AT instance
Parameter.Notes: Attaches SIM Toolkit to the AT instance

Parameter.name: SIM Toolkit Interface Enable
Parameter.Help: Enables the sim toolkit interface. This is only necessary for US applications. For the US set to 1 else set to 0.
Parameter.Notes: Enables the sim toolkit interface. This is only necessary for US applications. For the US set to 1 else set to 0.

Parameter.name: USIM Mode
Parameter.Help:
Enables the use of Version 6 and later SIMs. Not available on all versions of firmware so make sure this may be used before enabling.
0 - Command is not run 1 - Turn OFF USIM Application 2 - Turn on USIM Application with Sim Toolkit Disabled 3 - Turn on USIM Application with Sim Toolkit Enabled > 3 command is not run.
Parameter.Notes:
Enables the use of Version 6 and later SIMs. Not available on all versions of firmware so make sure this may be used before enabling.
0 - Command is not run 1 - Turn OFF USIM Application 2 - Turn on USIM Application with Sim Toolkit Disabled 3 - Turn on USIM Application with Sim Toolkit Enabled > 3 command is not run.

Parameter.name: Allow GPRS Error Modem Reset
Parameter.Notes: Enabling this parameter allows error accumulation eventually leading to a modem reboot. This may be undesirable on networks that charge for APN connections.

Parameter.name: Connection Timeout
Parameter.Help: Max connection establishment time.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE WITHOUT CONSULTING RELEVANT DOCUMENTATION.

Parameter.name: DNS Cache Control
Parameter.Help: Changes the behaviour of the modem onboard DNS cache at modem startup. 0 - Do not alter behaviour 1 - Enable DNS caching 172 - Disable and clear cache.
Parameter.Notes: Changes the behaviour of the modem onboard DNS cache at modem startup. 0 - Do not alter behaviour 1 - Enable DNS caching 172 - Disable and clear cache.

Parameter.name: Enable APN Reattachment
Parameter.Help: Perform APN reattachment during Socket Standoff period.
Parameter.Notes: This works in conjunction with the "Session Attempts Before Standoff" parameter. If this parameter is enabled then the MHub will do an APN reattachment during the standoff period.

Parameter.name: Enable Hardcore Modem Recovery
Parameter.Help: 1 - Enables Modem Power-cycle if no MProfiler communication has taken place within Recovery Time 2 - Enables MHub reset.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This parameter works in conjunction with Permanent TCP socket. If the unit expects to be constantly in contact with MProfiler and has NOT contacted MProfiler for a settable period (Hard Core Recovery Time) then a complete MHub reset will take place.

Parameter.name: Enable Power State Report
Parameter.Help: Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when the power state of the 801 changes.
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub changes its power state (Full, IDLe, SLEEP) it is able to notify MProfiler that it is about to change its power state.Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality.

Parameter.name: Enable Resume Report
Parameter.Help: Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when a socket is resumed after a suspend.
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub resumes a socket connection to Mprofiler after it has been suspended, it is able to notify MProfiler that it has resumed the socket connection. Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality.

Parameter.name: Enable Socket Close
Parameter.Help: Enables the unit to close a socket so that voice and data calls may be dealt with
Parameter.Notes: In order to be able to answer an incomming voice call, the MHub must close a socket connection if it is currently open. Setting this parameter to 1 will allow the socket to be closed. If this is set to 0, then the MHUb will not be able to close the socket, and thus a voice call will not be possible.

Parameter.name: Enable Socket Close Report
Parameter.Help: Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when a socket is closed.
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub closes a socket connection to Mprofiler, it is able to notify MProfiler that it is about to close the socket. Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality

Parameter.name: Enable Suspend
Parameter.Help: Enables suspension of a socket for maintenance purposes
Parameter.Notes: Setting this parameter to 1 will allow the MHub to suspend the socket. Thus function is needed to be able to read some data from the modem such as the signal strength, or to look for an incomming SMS

Parameter.name: Enable Suspend Report
Parameter.Help: Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when a socket is suspended
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub suspends a socket connection to Mprofiler, it is able to notify MProfiler that it is about to suspend the socket - just so that MProfiler knows about this. Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality

Parameter.name: Global Timeout
Parameter.Help: Socket Configuration: Max amount of time of the socket not going into active state (i.e. being suspended) before connection falls out.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE WITHOUT CONSULTING RELEVANT DOCUMENTATION.

Parameter.name: Hardcore Reset Trigger Time
Parameter.Help: Amount of time for no valid login to MProfiler to be detected before the Hard Core Modem recovery kicks in.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Number of seconds before the Modem/MHub reboots due to failing to contact the MProfiler.

Parameter.name: Maximum Message Completion time
Parameter.Help: This is the maximum amount of time that the unit will wait, after receiving a header, for the rest of a message to be received.
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub starts recieving data over GPRS, it needs to wait until the entire message has been recieved bofore it can start decoding the message. If the MHUb recieves only the forst part of the messaage, this parameter defines the time that the MHub will wait to recieve the remainder of the message. If the entire message is not recieved within this time. The MHub will discard the message.

Parameter.name: Maximum Socket Login Attempts
Parameter.Help: The maximum number of attempts that a unit may make to login, before tearing down the socket.
Parameter.Notes: Using GPRS, the MHub will open a socket connection to the MProfiler server, and then attempt to login into MProfiler. If the login credentials on the MHub are incorrect, MProfiler will reject the the login attempt. This parameter specifies the number of time that the MHub will accept a rejection before closing the socket (XXX - Note - will Mprofiler ever close the socket in the event of incorrect logins)

Parameter.name: Maximum Socket Transmission Attempts
Parameter.Help: Maximum number of attempts the MHub will make to transmit a packet before the socket is torn down. The message is also failed.
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub transmits a message over GPRS to the MProfiler, tyhe MHub expects a response to that message. If it does not recieve the response with the time specified in parameter xxx, then the message is failed and needs to be resent. This parameter specifies the number of retries that the MHub will make to send a specific message before the message is failed completely. If the message is an event to be sent to Mprofiler, event though the specific message fails after all the retries, the event(s) will be resent at a later stage.

Parameter.name: MProfiler Session Attempts Before Standoff
Parameter.Help: The number of attempts that the MHub will make to establish a session with MProfiler before the standoff period comes into effect.
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub attempts to make a GPRS connection to Mprofiler, and the attempt is not successful, it will try again. After a number of tries the MHub must assume that a login is not possible at this time, and then enters a standoff period where is will wait for a certain time before trying agan. This parameter specifies the number of login attempts before the standoff period kicks in.

Parameter.name: Packet Size
Parameter.Help: The minimum data packet sent to the net.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE WITHOUT CONSULTING RELEVANT DOCUMENTATION.

Parameter.name: Socket Block Time
Parameter.Help: The amount of time that establishment of a socket will be blocked after a socket is deliberately closed to allow for incoming voice or data calls.
Parameter.Notes: When the Mhub has an open socket to Mprofiler and and there is an incommng voice or data call. The MHub has to close the socket. After the call is completed, the MHub may then need to reopen the socket again. In the instance that say the voice call is dropped, and the caller makes the call to the MHub again, we not not want the Mprofiler to immediately open the socket again immediately just to have to close it again with the second call comes in. This parameter will set a time in seconds from when the socket is closed till when the MHub will open up the socket again

Parameter.name: Socket Suspend Period
Parameter.Help: Number of seconds between successive suspends, i.e. Periodic suspend period
Parameter.Notes: The MHub may suspend the socket to perform some activity that cannot be done while the socket is active. The specifies the minimum time that the socket must be held active before allowing the MHub to suspend it. Note that during suspension the socket remains open.

Parameter.name: Socket Suspend Time
Parameter.Help: Maximum amount of time that the GPRS socket may be suspended for the modem to take care of other tasks e.g handling SMS\'s
Parameter.Notes: In order to perform some tasks such as looking for SMS messages when there is an open GPRS socket, requires the MHub to suspend the socket for a while. This parameter specifies the maximum time in seconds for which the socket may be suspended

Parameter.name: Socket Transmission Timeout
Parameter.Help: The time that the (N)Ack may take to reach the MHub before the related transmission attempt expires.
Parameter.Notes: When the Mhub send data to the Mprofiler using GPRS, it always expects a message back from the Mprofiler, either a positive of negative acknowledge. However the Mhub will only wait a certain time for this reply from Mprofiler before the message attempt by the Mhub is expired. This parameter specifies the length of time that the MHub will wait for a response from Mprofiler, the default is usually 120 seconds.

Parameter.name: TCP Session Standoff Period
Parameter.Help: The amount of time that the MHub will wait in between socket attempts after the maximum number of unsuccessful session attempts.
Parameter.Notes: After the standoff period starts as defined in parameter xxx, this parameter specifies the time in seconds that the standoff period will last before the MHub attempts to log into Mprofiler again.

Parameter.name: Connection Type TCP / GPRS TCP / LTE
Parameter.Help: Enables a GPRS or LTE connection to MProfiler
Parameter.Notes: Enables a GPRS or LTE connection to MProfiler

Parameter.name: MProfiler MSISDN
Parameter.Help: MSISDN of the MProfiler SMS Gateway.
Parameter.Notes: The MHub always sends data to the MProfiler, this includes sending data to MProfiler via GPRS and SMS. When data is sent via SMS, the MHub needs to know where the SMS must be sent to - this will typically be a SMPP Gateway or even a modem directly connected to the MHub.

Parameter.name: MProfiler URL
Parameter.Help: This is the URL of the MProfiler Server. It is used by the MHub to know where to open up a socket to.
Parameter.Notes: This is the URL of the MProfiler Server. It is used by the MHub to know where to open up a socket to.

Parameter.name: MProfiler User Name
Parameter.Help: User name used when logging onto MProfiler over a TCP socket.
Parameter.Notes: When connecting to MProfiler using GPRS, the MHub needs to uniquely identify itself to MProfiler before the connection will be accepted. It identifies itself by means of the MProfiler User Name. before the connection will be acc epted, an entity on MProfiler must already exist with the same MProfier User Name as the UnitID on MProfiler. Care must be taken to ensure that no two MHub's are configured with the same MProfiler User Name, as then the information from two different MHub units will be sent o to the client application as a single unit. Typically the MSISDN of the SIM card can be used.

Parameter.name: Password Seed
Parameter.Help: Used in communications to a mobile phone for certificate management.
Parameter.Notes: Used in communications to a mobile phone for certificate management.

Parameter.name: TCP Port ID
Parameter.Help: TCP Port through which the socket will be opened
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub connects to MProfiler vis GPRS the Mhub opens up a socket to the MProfiler Server. This parameter specifies the port through which the socket will be opened.

Parameter.name: TCP Socket Login Timeout
Parameter.Help: The amount of time that the unit will allow a login challenge to go unanswered before retrying.
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub opens a socket an logs into Mprofiler, the Mhub sends a specific login request. If it does not recieve a response to this request within the time specified by this parameter, it will resend the login request again. (XXX how does this compare to the other parameter that says about the same thing for response times)

Parameter.name: Text SMS Destination MSISDN 1
Parameter.Help: Destination 1 MSISDN for Text messages
Parameter.Notes: The MHub has the ability to send a text message when an event occurs in addition to sending the message to Mprofiler. This parameter contains the MSISDN of the mobile phone to which the test message must be transmitted.

Parameter.name: Text SMS Destination MSISDN 2
Parameter.Help: Destination 2 MSISDN for Text messages
Parameter.Notes: The MHub has the ability to send a text message when an event occurs in addition to sending the message to Mprofiler. This parameter contains the MSISDN of the mobile phone to which the test message must be transmitted.

Parameter.name: Text SMS Destination MSISDN 3
Parameter.Help: Destination 3 MSISDN for Text messages
Parameter.Notes: The MHub has the ability to send a text message when an event occurs in addition to sending the message to Mprofiler. This parameter contains the MSISDN of the mobile phone to which the test message must be transmitted.

Parameter.name: Text SMS Destination MSISDN 4
Parameter.Help: Destination 4 MSISDN for Text messages
Parameter.Notes: The MHub has the ability to send a text message when an event occurs in addition to sending the message to Mprofiler. This parameter contains the MSISDN of the mobile phone to which the test message must be transmitted.

Parameter.name: Text SMS Destination MSISDN 5
Parameter.Help: Destination 5 MSISDN for Text messages
Parameter.Notes: The MHub has the ability to send a text message when an event occurs in addition to sending the message to Mprofiler. This parameter contains the MSISDN of the mobile phone to which the test message must be transmitted.

Parameter.name: Acceleration Limit
Parameter.Help: Acceleration Limit in km/h/s
Parameter.Notes: The MHub detects the acceleration and deceleration of the vehcile by using the speed sensor. If the MHub accelerates faster than the value specified in this parameter, is it deemed to be in the excessive acceleration violation state. The units of this parameter is in km/h/s.

Parameter.name: Accelerometer Ignition On Threshold
Parameter.Help: Accelerometer Ignition On Threshold
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
If Accelerometer value is greater than this parameter, Accelerometer Ignition flag will be set.

Parameter.name: Always Update Odometer
Parameter.Help: Update Odometer even when Ignition or Trip is false.
Parameter.Notes: Update Odometer even when Ignition or Trip is false. Odometer reading is not normally updated outside of a trip or when ignition off because of GPS drift, E.g. Gps Position changes when vehicle is stationary, because it can cause big odometer errors.

Parameter.name: Analog Debounce
Parameter.Help: Analog Debounce
Parameter.Notes: Minimum time analog value has to be below or above threshold to trigger flag

Parameter.name: Analog High Threshold
Parameter.Help: Analog High Threshold
Parameter.Notes: Analog High Threshold

Parameter.name: Analog Low Threshold
Parameter.Help: Analog Low Threshold
Parameter.Notes: Analog Low Threshold

Parameter.name: Analog Rate-Of-Change Threshold
Parameter.Help: Analog Rate-Of-Change Threshold
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Analog Rate-Of-Change Threshold is the maximum allowed Analog value change over the analog debounce period

Parameter.name: Auto Calibration Speed Threshold
Parameter.Help: Auto Calibration Speed Min Speed
Parameter.Notes:
When the source for speed or distance is set to the speed sensor, it is required that the sensor be calibrated first before the vehcile can be used for the readings to be accurate. This is typically done by programming the calibration factor (parameter "OBC ODO Calibration"). There is however an automated way of doing this. The Mhub is aware of its speed in anycase from the GPS sensor, so it is possible to use the GPS sensor to calibrate the speed sensor. If automatic calubration is required, the parameter "Auto Calibration Activation" is set to 1, and the MHub will then attempt to calibrate itself. This parameter specifies the minimum speed that the MHub will use to calibrate itself.
In order to calibrate itself, the Vehicle must travel at a constant speed of greater than the value in this parameter for the time duration specified in "Auto Calibration Debounce".

Parameter.name: Auto Calibration Activation
Parameter.Help: Auto Calibration Activation
Parameter.Notes: When the source for speed or distance is set to the speed sensor, it is required that the sensor be calibrated first before the vehcile can be used for the readings to be accurate. This is typically done by programming the calibration factor (parameter "OBC ODO Calibration"). There is however an automated way of doing this. The Mhub is aware of its speed in anycase from the GPS sensor, so it is possible to use the GPS sensor to calibrate the speed sensor. If automatic calubration is required, this parameter is set to 1, and the MHub will then attempt to calibrate itself. Once the MHub has successfully calibrated itself, it will clear this parameter to 0.

Parameter.name: Auto Calibration Debounce
Parameter.Help: Auto Calibration Debounce debounce time in seconds
Parameter.Notes: This parameter specifies for how long the vehicle must travel in seconds at a constant speed above the value specified in parameter "Auto Calibration Speed Threshold" for Auto Calibration to occur.

Parameter.name: Braking Limit
Parameter.Help: Braking Limit in km/h/s
Parameter.Notes: The MHub detects the acceleration and deceleration of the vehcile by using the speed sensor. If the MHub decelerates faster than the value specified in this parameter, is it deemed to be in the harch braking violation state. The units of this parameter is in km/h/s.

Parameter.name: Direction Change Debouce
Parameter.Help: Direction Change Debounce in Seconds
Parameter.Notes: Direction Change Debounce in Seconds. Minimum time between Tachograph events or minimum time that direction needs to be static for event to be raised

Parameter.name: Direction Change Minimum Speed
Parameter.Help: Direction Change Minimum Speed in km/h
Parameter.Notes: Direction Change Minimum Speed in km/h. Minimum speed required for Tachograph direction change event to be raised

Parameter.name: Drive Slot 1 End Time
Parameter.Help: Drive Slot 1 End Time in Minutes from 00:00
Parameter.Notes: Drive Slot 1 End Time in Minutes from 00:00

Parameter.name: Drive Slot 1 Start Time
Parameter.Help: Drive Slot 1 Start Time in Minutes from 00:00
Parameter.Notes: Drive Slot 1 Start Time in Minutes from 00:00

Parameter.name: Drive Slot 2 End Time
Parameter.Help: Drive Slot 2 End Time in Minutes from 00:00
Parameter.Notes: Drive Slot 2 End Time in Minutes from 00:00

Parameter.name: Drive Slot 2 Start Time
Parameter.Help: Drive Slot 2 Start Time in Minutes from 00:00
Parameter.Notes: Drive Slot 2 Start Time in Minutes from 00:00

Parameter.name: Driver Key Leds Enable
Parameter.Help: Driver Key Leds Enable
Parameter.Notes: The driver and passenger key reading receptacles have LED on them. This parameter will control whether those LED's are used or not.

Parameter.name: Engine Hours from MHub Ignition ON Hours
Parameter.Help: Engine Hours is determined by the MHub Ignition ON Hours
Parameter.Notes: Engine Hours is determined by the MHub Ignition ON Hours

Parameter.name: Engine Hours from Vehicle Network
Parameter.Help: Engine Hours is retrieved from the vehicle network
Parameter.Notes: Engine Hours is retrieved from the vehicle network

Parameter.name: Excessive Acceleration and Harsh Braking Delay
Parameter.Help: Delay used for Excessive Acceleration and Harsh Braking Event Generation
Parameter.Notes: When the MHub detects an excessive braking or acceleration violation, this parameter will specify the minimum duration in seconds of that violation before an exception event will be generated.

Parameter.name: Excessive Idle Delay
Parameter.Help: Delay used for Excess Idle Event Generation
Parameter.Notes: Excessive Idle is when the vehicle is standing still with the ignition or engine still on. In order to prevent the excessive idle event being generated when the vehicle is simply stopped at a traffic light, this parameter will specify the minimum duration in seconds that the vechile must have been in the idle state before the vehicle is assumed to be in an excessive idle state. XXX - is 0 an appropriate default value?

Parameter.name: Free Wheel RPM Threshold
Parameter.Help: RPM High limit for Free Wheel condition
Parameter.Notes: This is the freewheeling RPM threshold on units of x100 RPM. When the vehicle RPM is below this value, and the speed is above the value specified in parameter "Speed Free Wheel Threshold", and this condition persists for more than the time specified in "OBC Free Wheeling Debounce", then the vehicle in in a state of freewheeling, and a freewheeling event can be generated.

Parameter.name: Fuel Source
Parameter.Help: Fuel Source selection
Parameter.Notes: Select the source for Fuel 0 - No Source Selected 1 - Vehicle Network 2 - Flow Meters on Input 1 and 2 and Fuel level on Analog Input 1

Parameter.name: Harsh Acceleration Source
Parameter.Help: Harsh Acceleration Source
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Harsh Acceleration Source: 0 : Sensor 1 : Accelerometer

Parameter.name: Harsh Braking Source
Parameter.Help: Harsh Braking Source
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Harsh Braking Source: 0 : Sensor 1 : Accelerometer

Parameter.name: Ignition OFF Source from Main Voltage Threshold
Parameter.Help: Main Voltage Threshold for Ignition Off if Ignition Source from Main Voltage
Parameter.Notes: When main voltage is used as the source of ignition, this parameter is the voltage threshold below which ignition will be assumed OFF. Typically in a 12V vehicle this should be 13V, the parameter is in 100mv steps, thus the value of the parameter will be 130. Setting this value to 0 switches off this functionality and the unit will fall back to normal ignition off detection.

Parameter.name: Ignition Pending Checking
Parameter.Help: Enable Ignition Pending Checking
Parameter.Notes: Enable the unit to start a trip in a pending state to fasilitate the faster detection of a trip start

Parameter.name: Ignition Source from Main Voltage Threshold
Parameter.Help: Main Voltage Threshold for Ignition On if Ignition Source from Main Voltage
Parameter.Notes:
When main voltage is used as the source of ignition, this parameter is the voltage threshold above which ignition will be assumed ON. Typically in a 12V vehicle this should be 13V, the parameter is in 100mv steps, thus the value of the parameter will be 130.
XXX - just a comment - what about a 24V vehicle, will 255 be enough - should the parameter no be increased to 16 bits?

Parameter.name: Ignition Source from RPM Threshold
Parameter.Help: RPM Threshold for Ignition On if Ignition Source from RPM
Parameter.Notes: When the source of ignition is set to RPM, the value of this parameter contains the threshold RPM above which the vehicles ignition is deemed to be ON.

Parameter.name: Ignition Source from Speed Threshold
Parameter.Help: Speed Threshold for Ignition On if Ignition Source from Speed
Parameter.Notes: When the source of ignition is set to Speed, the value of this parameter contains the threshold Speed above which the vehicles ignition is deemed to be ON.

Parameter.name: Ignition Source: Accelerometer
Parameter.Help: Ignition Source: Accelerometer
Parameter.Notes: One more possible source of ignition is to use Accelerometer movement. If Accelerometer movement is greater than the value specified in parameter "Accelerometer Ignition On Threshold", the vehicle is moving. If Accelerometer is to be used as ignition, this parameter is set to 1.

Parameter.name: Ignition Source: Alternate
Parameter.Help: Ignition Source: Alternate
Parameter.Notes: Ignition Source Alternate uses new method for ignition. Configure sources with Trip Source Ignition Line etc.

Parameter.name: Ignition Source: CAN
Parameter.Help: Ignition Source: CAN
Parameter.Notes: When CAN bus is used, this can also be used for the source of ignition.

Parameter.name: Ignition Source: Ignition Line
Parameter.Help: Ignition Source: Ignition Line
Parameter.Notes: For correct operation of the Mhub in a vehicle, the MHub needs to know the state of the ignition line of the vehicle. There is however more than one way that the MHUb can detect the state of ignition. If the IGnition wire input of the MHub is conbnected to the ignition of the vehicle, then this value must be set to 1, and the MHub will use the ignition line as the source of ignition.

Parameter.name: Ignition Source: Main Voltage
Parameter.Help: Ignition Source: Main Voltage
Parameter.Notes: In addition to being able to use the ignition line as the source of ignition for the MHub, to make an installation easier without having to connect the ignition line, the source fro ignition can be set to main voltage. To do this, this parameter is enable. If ignition is set to main voltage, the MHub will monitor the input voltage, and if it is above the threshold specified in "Ignition Source from Main Voltage Threshold", the ignition is ON, and below the threshold, ignition is OFF.

Parameter.name: Ignition Source: RPM
Parameter.Help: Ignition Source: RPM
Parameter.Notes: One more possible source of ignition is to use RPM. If RPM is greater than the value specified in parameter "Ignition Source from RPM Threshold", the engine is running and the ignition is ON. If rpm is to be used as ignition, this parameter is set to 1.

Parameter.name: Ignition Source: Trigger
Parameter.Help: Ignition Source: Trigger
Parameter.Notes: Ignition Source is set to Trigger which is a software controlled ignition source.

Parameter.name: Input 1 Active Tracking
Parameter.Help: Input 1 to trigger Active Tracking mode
Parameter.Notes: Input 1 to trigger Active Tracking mode

Parameter.name: Input 1 Pulses per Unit
Parameter.Help: Input 1 Pulses per Unit
Parameter.Notes: Input Pulses per Unit to measure. If the input is used to measure fuel using a fuel flow meter and the meter is calibrated to say 320 pulses per liter then set this value to 320 to get the value reported as liters or set it to 32 to get the value reported in 100ml units.

Parameter.name: Input 2 Pulses per Unit
Parameter.Help: Input 2 Pulses per Unit
Parameter.Notes: Input Pulses per Unit to measure. If the input is used to measure fuel using a fuel flow meter and the meter is calibrated to say 320 pulses per liter then set this value to 320 to get the value reported as liters or set it to 32 to get the value reported in 100ml units.

Parameter.name: Last Programmed Odometer
Parameter.Help: The last programmed odometer
Parameter.Notes: The last programmed odometer, used for callibration purposes

Parameter.name: Main Voltage Low Debounce (min)
Parameter.Help: Main Voltage Low Debounce
Parameter.Notes: Main Voltage Low Debounce in 1 minute units

Parameter.name: Main Voltage Low Pre-Sleep Scan Report Count
Parameter.Help: The number of reports that must be generated before the unit will expedite sleep scan to send the reports. 0 - Disables this feature. The event will only be sent at the next scheduled sleep scan. >0 - Enables immediate sleep scan once the number of events has been generated. This number should be less than or equal to the Mains low report count. If this parameter is set to any value and the Report Count is zero then sleep scan will be expedited after the first event.
Parameter.Notes:
The number of reports that must be generated before the unit will expedite sleep scan to send the reports.
0 - Disables this feature. The event will only be sent at the next scheduled sleep scan.The unit will not wake to sleep scan.
>0 - Enables immediate sleep scan once the number of events has been generated.
This number should be less than or equal to the Mains low report count.
**NB:** If this parameter is set to any value and the Report Count is set to zero then sleep scan will be expedited after the first event and not after the configured number of events.

Parameter.name: Main Voltage Low Report Count
Parameter.Help: Number of times that the Mains Voltage Low event will be sent. If set to zero then reports will continue indefinitely
Parameter.Notes: Number of times that the Mains Voltage Low event will be sent. If set to zero then reports will continue indefinitely

Parameter.name: Main Voltage Low Report Interval
Parameter.Help: Main Voltage Low Interval in seconds
Parameter.Notes: Main Voltage Low Interval in seconds. If a low main voltage input is detected for longer than 10 seconds, the MHub can send a Main Voltage Low event if configured. Threshold in paramater "Main Voltage Low Threshold". Note: Event generation occurs at time-out + 10 seconds. e.g. 3590 seconds + 10 seconds results in 3600 seconds Interval

Parameter.name: Main Voltage Low Threshold
Parameter.Help: Threshold at which the Main Voltage is considered low.
Parameter.Notes: The MHub measures the state of the input voltage, and can generate an event if this input voltage drops too low. This parameter specifies the voltage threshold in 0.1V resolution.

Parameter.name: Main Voltage Low Voltage Hysteresis
Parameter.Help: Main Voltage Low Voltage Hysteresis
Parameter.Notes: Voltage Hysteresis in 0.1V units. When the voltage drops below the Main Voltage Low threshold, the voltage has to rise above Main Voltage Low Threshold + Main Voltage Low Voltage Hysteresis to be considered not low anymore.

Parameter.name: Mains Dev. Ignition On Threshold
Parameter.Help: Mains Dev. Ignition On Threshold
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Mains Dev. Threshold

Parameter.name: MHub Description
Parameter.Help: MHub Description
Parameter.Notes: This text description of the MHub in this parameter is used when sending a text SMS event.

Parameter.name: Minimum Excess RPM Time
Parameter.Help: Minimum time of excessive RPM before a Excess RPM Event is generated
Parameter.Notes: This parameter will allow the RPM to exceed the configured limit for a time without the excessive RPM event being generated. If RPM remains above the limit for longer than the time specified in this parameter in seconds, then an exception event will be generated.

Parameter.name: Minimum Speeding Time
Parameter.Help: Minimum time of excessive speed before a Speeding Event is generated
Parameter.Notes: In order to provide a driver with a bit of leeway with regard to speeding - for instance when overtaking and exceeding the speed limit for only a short period, the MHub implements a minimum speeding time. The vehicle must therefore be speeding for longer than the minimum time before a speeding event is generated. This parameter specifies that minimum speeding time in seconds.

Parameter.name: Non Trip Position Report Interval
Parameter.Help: Periodic Position while a trip is not in progress
Parameter.Notes: Similar to the Periodic Position Event, the MHub also has the ability to send an event when the ignition is OFF. The value of this parameter specifies the interval in seconds that the MHub will send the Non Trip Periodic events.

Parameter.name: OBC Free Wheeling Debounce
Parameter.Help: OBC Free Wheeling Debounce
Parameter.Notes: The MHub can detect freewheeling. This is where the driver of a vehicle depresses the clutch while still travelling at a relatively high speed. This is deemed to be a bad driving practise. It is detected when the RPM is below the threshold specified in "Free Wheel RPM Threshold", and the speed is above the threshold specified in "Speed Free Wheel Threshold". It may however be permissable to freewheel for a short period of time. This parameter specifies the minimum amount of time in seconds above which the event will be generated.

Parameter.name: OBC GPS Odometer
Parameter.Help: OBC GPS Odometer
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: OBC GPS Speed
Parameter.Help: OBC GPS Speed
Parameter.Notes: Setting the unit to use GPS as it's speed source

Parameter.name: OBC High Res. Calibration
Parameter.Help: High resolution Odometer calibration
Parameter.Notes: This bit enables high resolution Odometer calibration.

Parameter.name: OBC Ignition Minute Odometer
Parameter.Help: OBC Ignition Minute Odometer
Parameter.Notes: For stationary applications Ignition On minutes can be used as Odometer source. Hence Service Events can be raised based on Engine Minutes. 1 Minute = 1 Meter

Parameter.name: OBC ODO Calibration
Parameter.Help: OBC ODO Calibration Value
Parameter.Notes: Calibration factor for the speed sensor input. This parameter contains the calibration factor that will convert the pulses recieved from the speed sensor into accurate distance, speed and acceleration values. The calibration factor is essentially the number of pulses receieved from the speed sensor when the vehicle travels 100m.

Parameter.name: OBC ODO Loop
Parameter.Help: OBC ODO Timer prescaler
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This parameter effectively defines the time period over which the distance pulses are counted to calculate the actual distance and speed. A value of 20 could equate to 1 second.

Parameter.name: OBC Pulse Filters
Parameter.Help: OBC Pulse Filters
Parameter.Notes: Set OBC Pulse Filters to 1 to enable feature. This feature limits the pulse counter to remove high frequency noise. The sampling frequency of the sensor inputs are reduced so that RPM pulses will not exceed 9000RPM and ODO pulses will not to exceed 255km/h based on the current RPM and ODO calibration factors.

Parameter.name: OBC RPM Calibration
Parameter.Help: OBC RPM Calibration Value
Parameter.Notes: This is the RPM calibration factor.

Parameter.name: OBC RPM Loop
Parameter.Help: OBC RPM Timer Prescaler
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This parameter effectively defines the time period over which the RPM pulses are counted to calculate the actual RPM. A value of 10 could equate to 0.5 seconds.

Parameter.name: OBC Sensor Filters
Parameter.Help: OBC Sensor Filters
Parameter.Notes: This feature will enable the filtering of Speed and RPM using a 0.5Hz Low Pass Filter and filtering of SpeedMax and RPMMax using a 0.1Hz Low Pass Filter.

Parameter.name: OBC Sensor Odometer
Parameter.Help: OBC Sensor Odometer
Parameter.Notes: This is the odometer reading of the MHub. although the MHub will increment it as required. The initial value is programmed into this parameter.

Parameter.name: OBC Sensor RPM
Parameter.Help: RPM sourced from sensor
Parameter.Notes: The MHub can take its source of RPM from various inputs. If RPM is determined by connecting the RPM wite to the "W" terminal, then this parameter must be set to 1.

Parameter.name: OBC Sensor Speed
Parameter.Help: OBC Sensor Speed
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: OBC Speed Pulse Threshold
Parameter.Help: OBC Speed Pulse Threshold
Parameter.Notes: OBC Speed Pulse Threshold. Only Speed pulses greater than this threshold will result in speed being calculated from Speed Pulses. Only use this if spurious low speed readings are observed.

Parameter.name: OBC Vehicle Network Odometer
Parameter.Help: OBC Vehicle Network Odometer
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: OBC Vehicle Network Speed
Parameter.Help: OBC J1939 FMS OBD2 Speed
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: OBC Vehicle Network RPM
Parameter.Help: RPM sourced from J1939 FMS OBD2
Parameter.Notes: The MHub can take its source of RPM from various inputs. If RPM is determined by using the RPM value read from the J1939 FMS OBD2 CANBus, then this parameter must be set to 1. From J1939 FMS Enable J1939 FMS CANbus Interface = 1 From OBD2 Enable Vehicle OBD2 Interface

Parameter.name: Output 3 Used for Buzzer
Parameter.Help: Use Output 3 as Buzzer Output
Parameter.Notes: Output 3 can be configured to be controlled by the Buzzer control in addition of the Speaker beeper/ringer output.

Parameter.name: Output 4 Follows Ignition
Parameter.Help: Output 4 Follows Ignition
Parameter.Notes: Output 4 Follows Ignition. If Driver Key Immobilisation is selected control will be handed over to Driver Key functionality

Parameter.name: Position Report Distance Interval
Parameter.Help: The distance between successive position reports during a trip
Parameter.Notes: The distance between successive position reports during a trip

Parameter.name: Position Report Interval
Parameter.Help: The period between sucessive periodic position reports during a trip
Parameter.Notes: When a vehicle is travelling (ignition is ON) mostly it is required that the MHub will send events at regular intervals. This parameter specifies the interval in seconds between which the MHub will send Periodic Position events which the vehicle ignition is ON and it is not in an excessive idle state.

Parameter.name: Position Report Interval - Idle
Parameter.Help: The period between successive periodic position reports if vehicle idle
Parameter.Notes: When a vehicle is travelling (ignition is ON) mostly it is required that the MHub will send events at regular intervals. This parameter specifies the interval in seconds between which the MHub will send Periodic Position events which the vehicle ignition is ON and it is in an excessive idle state.

Parameter.name: Rate of Change
Parameter.Help: Rate of Change in 1/10 of Degrees
Parameter.Notes: Rate of Change threshold in 1/10 of Degrees for tachograph event to be generated. 0 - Rate of Change is not taken into account

Parameter.name: Recovery Mode Signal
Parameter.Help: Recovery Mode Signal
Parameter.Notes: Configure which output to use to switch external equipment when recovery mode is activated. 0, 5, 6, 7 - Off 1 - Output 1 2 - Output 2 3 - Output 3 4 - Output 4

Parameter.name: Recovery Mode Signal Inverted
Parameter.Help: Recovery Mode Signal should be inverted
Parameter.Notes: This bit determines if the output state should be inverted compared to the state of the recovery mode. E.g. If the unit is in recovery mode then the output is OFF else the output is ON

Parameter.name: RPM Green Band High
Parameter.Help: Green Band RPM high limit
Parameter.Notes: Green Band RPM high limit in x 100

Parameter.name: RPM Green Band Low
Parameter.Help: Green Band RPM low limit
Parameter.Notes: Green Band RPM Low limit in x 100

Parameter.name: RPM Limit
Parameter.Help: RPM limit at which point an exception is occuring
Parameter.Notes: This is the RPM limit in x100 RPM units above which the vehicle will be deemed to be exceeding the RPM limit.

Parameter.name: Selected Speed Signal Loss Timeout
Parameter.Help: The number of seconds of GPS speed being above a threshold and Selected Speed being less than 5km/h before a Selected Speed Signal Loss Timeout event is raised.
Parameter.Notes: The number of seconds of GPS speed being above a threshold and Selected Speed being less than 5km/h before a Selected Speed Signal Loss Timeout event is raised.

Parameter.name: Selected Speed-Signal Loss Speed Difference
Parameter.Help: The minimum difference in speed between the GPS speed and the selected speed before a Speed Signal loss is detected
Parameter.Notes: The minimum difference in speed between the GPS speed and the selected speed before a Speed Signal loss is detected

Parameter.name: Speed Free Wheel Threshold
Parameter.Help: Speed minimum limit for Free Wheel condition
Parameter.Notes: Freewheeling speed threshold in km/h. When the vehicle speed is above this value, and the RPM is below the value specified in parameter "Free Wheel RPM Threshold", and this condition persists for more than the time specified in "OBC Free Wheeling Debounce", then the vehicle in in a state of freewheeling, and a freewheeling event can be generated.

Parameter.name: Speed Limit
Parameter.Help: The speed limit in km/h
Parameter.Notes: This is the speed limit in km/h above which the vehicle will be deemed to be speeding.

Parameter.name: Speed Warning Limit
Parameter.Help: Speed limit warning value
Parameter.Notes: This is the speed limit warning value and is the speed limit at which point the MHub may issue a warning by means of a customized trigger. A value of 68 km/h means the trigger can check the current speed and if it is greater than 68 km/h it can set an output. This parameter should not be confused with the Geofence Speed Warning Level parameter.

Parameter.name: Tacho Graph Report Interval
Parameter.Help: Tacho Graph Reporting Interval
Parameter.Notes: The tachograph event is similar to the periodic position event. This event is defined for backward compatibity with older hardware

Parameter.name: Telemetry Template
Parameter.Help: Telemetry Template
Parameter.Notes: Telemetry Template

Parameter.name: Temperature Report Interval
Parameter.Help: Periodic Temperature Report Interval
Parameter.Notes: The MHub is able to periodically send the values of all 4 the temperature sensors. This parameter specifies the interval in seconds for sending the Periodic Temperature Event.

Parameter.name: Trip Source Accelerometer
Parameter.Help: Trip Source Accelerometer
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source Accelerometer the accelerometer movement has to exceed the accelerometer movement threshold for ignition on

Parameter.name: Trip Source CANBus
Parameter.Help: Trip Source CANBus
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source CANBus if CANBus activity is present ignition on. Most vehicles switch off the Vehicle CANBus outside of trip. Verify in the vehicle before enabling.

Parameter.name: Trip Source Geo Location
Parameter.Help: Trip Source Geo Location
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source Geo Location the unit creates a geo lock around current location. If vehicle moves more than 5m from that location ignition on.

Parameter.name: Trip Source GPS Speed
Parameter.Help: Trip Source GPS Speed
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source GPS Speed the gps speed has to exceed the speed threshold for ignition on. GPS speed is only used if the GPS signal is deemed good e.g. 3D lock for longer than 5 seconds with HDOP less than 100m

Parameter.name: Trip Source GSM
Parameter.Help: Trip Source GSM
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source GSM if the unit detects movement of the unit relative to cell towers ignition on

Parameter.name: Trip Source Ignition Line
Parameter.Help: Trip Source Ignition Line
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source Ignition Line using ignition input

Parameter.name: Trip Source Mains Delta
Parameter.Help: Trip Source Mains Delta
Parameter.Notes: Determines if ignition is on by measuring the difference between the current voltage level and the previous level

Parameter.name: Trip Source Mains Dev.
Parameter.Help: Trip Source Mains Dev
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source Mains Dev.

Parameter.name: Trip Source Mains Voltage
Parameter.Help: Trip Source Mains Voltage
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source Mains Voltage the mains supply voltage has to exceed the threshold for ignition on

Parameter.name: Trip Source OBD2 RPM
Parameter.Help: Trip Source OBD2 RPM
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source OBD2 RPM and RPM above 0 will trigger ignition on

Parameter.name: Trip Source OBD2 Speed
Parameter.Help: Trip Source OBD2 Speed
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source OBD2 Speed and speed above 0km/h will trigger ignition on

Parameter.name: Trip Source Trigger
Parameter.Help: Trip Source Trigger
Parameter.Notes: Trip Source Trigger the trigger mechanism can be used to enable ignition on. Can be used for application where standard ignition sources are not available.

Parameter.name: Daily Reset Enable
Parameter.Help: Daily Reset Enable
Parameter.Notes: The MHub has the ability to reset itself once a day. Setting this to 1 will enable this daily reset.

Parameter.name: Daily Reset Hardware Reset Enable
Parameter.Help: At the Daily Reset a full hardware reset will be performed. It is recommended to leave this enabled.
Parameter.Notes: When the daily reset is executed, it is only a restart of the system program. If this bit is set, the daily reset will also perform a hardware reset of the various components of the MHub as well.

Parameter.name: Daily Reset UTC Offset
Parameter.Help: Daily Reset offset from UTC in minutes. Positive offset only. E.g UTC + 2hrs => 120 UTC - 2hrs -> 1440 - 120 = 1320
Parameter.Notes: If the daily reset is enabled in parameter "Daily Reset Enable", this parameter will specify the time offset in minutes from midnight at which time the reste will occur. Keep in mind that the MHUhb operates only on GMT (UTC) time.

Parameter.name: PDA Connection Retry
Parameter.Help: PDA Connection Retry
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
PDA Connection Retry in seconds if set to 0 value will default to 60

Parameter.name: Power High Power Peripheral Lockout at startup
Parameter.Help: High Power Peripheral Lockout
Parameter.Notes: This prevents high power peripherals e.g. Modem, from powering up directly after system boot if the internal battery charge level is too low. Maximum Lockout time is 240s (4 minutes)

Parameter.name: Power Mode Deep-Sleep Delay from Sleep
Parameter.Help: The amount of time from entering Sleep mode to going into Deep-Sleep ultra-low power mode.
Parameter.Notes: This parameter specifies in seconds how long the MHub will wait from IDLE power mode before it enters Deep Sleepmode. Deep Sleep mode must be enable in parameter "Enable Deep Sleep Mode" before this will take effect.

Parameter.name: Power Mode Deep-Sleep Enable
Parameter.Help: Enable Deep Sleep Power Mode: Master Clock running 32Khz. Modem Sleep Scan Not Available. Wake-up from Ignition Only.
Parameter.Notes: In addition to the IDLE and SLEEP power modes of the Mhub, there is also an Deep Sleep Power state, where the MHub will only wake up from the ignition line being turned ON. It cannot periodically wake up to check for incomming messages. Setting this parameter will enable this Deep Sleep Power Mode.

Parameter.name: Power Mode Fast-Sleep Enable
Parameter.Help: Enable Fast Sleep. This allows the unit to shortcut the delays going into low power mode when the mains voltage drops below the configured threshold, e.g. in the case where a vehicle's battery charge has been depleted.
Parameter.Notes: If enabled the unit will go to sleep faster if Mains voltage drops below the Mains Voltage Sleep Threshold

Parameter.name: Power Mode Fast-Sleep Mains Voltage Threshold
Parameter.Help: Voltage threshold when unit will enter Sleep Mode quicker.
Parameter.Notes: Voltage threshold when unit will sleep quicker. In case the vehicle is parked for many days, reduce the impact of the MHub running at full power drain.

Parameter.name: Power Mode Idle Delay from Full
Parameter.Help: Time in seconds to IDLE Mode from FULL Power mode
Parameter.Notes: This parameter specifies in seconds how long the MHub will wait in full power mode after ignition is turned off until it enters IDLE mode. Idle mode must be enable in parameter "Enable IDLE Power Mode" before this will take effect.

Parameter.name: Power Mode Idle Mode Enable
Parameter.Help: GPS to idle power mode. Updates position every 30 seconds. GPS Speed and direction not available. 0: Normal 1: Idle Mode
Parameter.Notes: This parameter will allow the Mhub to enter into its IDLE power save mode. In the idle state, GPS positions are updated internally to the MHub every 30 seconds, and speed and direction values are not available. 1=Enable Idle Mode

Parameter.name: Power Mode Sleep Delay From Idle
Parameter.Help: Time in seconds to Sleep Mode from Idle
Parameter.Notes: This parameter specifies in seconds how long the MHub will wait in IDLE power mode before it enters IDLE mode. Sleep mode must be enable in parameter "Enable Sleep Mode" before this will take effect.

Parameter.name: Power Mode Sleep Mode Enable
Parameter.Help: Enable Unit Sleep Mode 0: Normal 1: Sleep Mode
Parameter.Notes: This parameter will allow the MHub to enter the sleep state. This is the lowest power state of the MHub. 1=Enable

Parameter.name: Power Mode Sleep Mode Function Enable
Parameter.Help: Global Power Sleep Mode Enablement variable. Program with value 0xCC to enable power sleep mode and any other value to disable.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Global Power Sleep Mode Enablement variable. Program with value 0xCC to enable power sleep mode and any other value to disable.

Parameter.name: Power Mode Sleep Scan Cycle Limit
Parameter.Help: Power Mode Sleep Scan Cycle Limit
Parameter.Notes:
Power Mode Sleep Scan Limit. The maximum number of sleep scan cycles before sleep scan is disabled. Sleep Scan counter is cleared with ignition on.
0 - Disabled 1:254 - Number of Sleep Scan Cycles before sleep scan is disabled. 255 - Disabled

Parameter.name: Power Mode Sleep Scan Period
Parameter.Help: Time in seconds to Sleep Modem Scan from entering Sleep Mode.
Parameter.Notes: When the unit is configured for Sleep mode it has to wake up every now and again to scan for any message that it might have received while sleeping. This parameter sets that time (in seconds)

Parameter.name: Power Mode Sleep Scan Time
Parameter.Help: Time in Seconds Sleep Scan will operate before returning to Sleep Mode
Parameter.Notes: When the unit is configured for Sleep mode it has to wake up every now and again to scan for any message that it might have received while sleeping. After it woke up it has to go back to sleep after a set time. This parameter sets that time (in seconds)

Parameter.name: Power Mode Sleep Standoff for Modem Power Down
Parameter.Help: Time in seconds Sleep will be delayed for the Modem to complete its power down.
Parameter.Notes: When the unit is configured for sleep mode it first powers the modem down and then goes into sleep mode. This parameters set the time in seconds from when the modem is powered down to when the unit goes into sleep mode.

Parameter.name: Power Mode Sleep-Scan Enable
Parameter.Help: Unit wakes up periodically from sleep to check for messages if Ultra Low Power Mode is disabled.
Parameter.Notes: When sleep mode is enabled, and the MHub has entered sleep mode, it is possible to configure the MHub to still periodically wake up and check to see if there are any SMS messages that have been sent to the MHub while it was in sleep mode. Setting this parameter will enable this functionality.

Parameter.name: Power Modes Keep Alive
Parameter.Help: If enabled the unit will be prevented from entering Sleep mode if communication from MHub Diagnostic or MProfiler is received
Parameter.Notes: Enable to keep unit alive if comms from MHub Diagnostic or MProfiler. MHub Diag - Keep Alive for 10 Seconds MProfiler - Keep Alive for 10 Minutes

Parameter.name: Power USB Charge Current Limit if No GPS
Parameter.Help: If GPS is no visible then limit the charge current
Parameter.Notes:
If USB Power Mode is enabled, Charge-In current will be limited to 100mA and SYSOUT will be powered from BAT.
NOTE: MAKE SURE POWER MODES->REGULATOR REGISTER 0 = 0, otherwise charge current can be more than USB POWER restrictions

Parameter.name: Power USB Current Limit with No GPS
Parameter.Help: Enable the USB Power Mode.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
If USB Power Mode is enabled, Charge-In current will be limited to 100mA and SYSOUT will be powered from BAT
NOTE: MAKE SURE POWER MODES->REGULATOR REGISTER 0 = 0, otherwise charge current can be more than USB POWER restrictions

Parameter.name: Receive SMS RI Pulse Length
Parameter.Help: Sets the pulse length of the Ring Indicator. 0 Switches it off. Valid range is 50 - 1150.
Parameter.Notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

Parameter.name: Regulator Register 0
Parameter.Help: Register 0 of AAT2601B
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
TIMER | RCHG1 | RCHG0 | CHG2 | CHG1 | CHG0 | TERM1 | TERM0 00 DEFAULT VALUE 04 CHARGER 80 percent 08 CHARGER 60 percent 0C CHARGER 40 percent 10 CHARGER 120 percent 14 CHARGER 140 percent 18 CHARGER 160 percent 1C CHARGER 180 percent

Parameter.name: Regulator Register 1
Parameter.Help: Register 1 of AAT2601B
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
NU | NU | NU | NU | NU | SYS | LDO1_1 | LDO1_0
SYS 0 If USE_USB = H, SYSOUT powered by BAT - If USB_USB = L, SYSOUT powered by CHGIN 1 SYSOUT always powered from BAT
LDO1_1 LDO1_0 00 3.30V 01 2.90V 10 2.85V 11 2.80V

Parameter.name: Regulator Register 2
Parameter.Help: Register 2 of AAT2601B
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
LDO5_1 | LDO5_0 | LDO4_1 | LDO4_0 | LDO3_1 | LDO3_0 | LDO2_1 | LDO2_0
LDO4 and LDO5 Bit 1 Bit 0 00 3.30V 01 2.90V 10 2.85V 11 2.80V
