Parameter.Help: Negative temperature coefficient (NTC) thermistor calibration
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Calibrate Thermistor reading for correct temperature read out

Parameter.name: Periodic Temperature only in Trip
Parameter.Help: Periodic Temperature event will only be sent inside trip
Parameter.Notes: 0 - Periodic Temperature Event always sent >0 - Periodic Temperature Event sent only in Trip

Parameter.name: Temperature 1 High Threshold
Parameter.Help: Temperature 1 High Threshold
Parameter.Notes: The value of this parameter specifies the high temperature threshold of temperature sensor 1. Note that the units of this parameter are celcius+50. Thus if the value for the high threshold is to be -10 celcius then set it to 40.

Parameter.name: Temperature 1 Low Threshold
Parameter.Help: Temperature 1 Low Threshold
Parameter.Notes: The value of this parameter specifies the low temperature threshold of temperature sensor 1. Note that the units of this parameter are celcius+50. Thus if the value for the low threshold is to be -10 celcius then set the value to 40.

Parameter.name: Temperature 2 High Threshold
Parameter.Help: Temperature 2 High Threshold
Parameter.Notes: See Temperature 1 High Threshold

Parameter.name: Temperature 2 Low Threshold
Parameter.Help: Temperature 2 Low Threshold
Parameter.Notes: See Temperature 1 Low Threshold

Parameter.name: Temperature 3 High Threshold
Parameter.Help: Temperature 3 High Threshold
Parameter.Notes: See Temperature 1 High Threshold

Parameter.name: Temperature 3 Low Threshold
Parameter.Help: Temperature 3 Low Threshold
Parameter.Notes: See Temperature 1 Low Threshold

Parameter.name: Temperature 4 High Threshold
Parameter.Help: Temperature 4 High Threshold
Parameter.Notes: See Temperature 1 High Threshold

Parameter.name: Temperature 4 Low Threshold
Parameter.Help: Temperature 4 Low Threshold
Parameter.Notes: See Temperature 1 Low Threshold

Parameter.name: Temperature Sensor 1 ID
Parameter.Help: Temperature Sensor 1 ID
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

Parameter.name: Temperature Sensor 2 ID
Parameter.Help: Temperature Sensor 2 ID
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

Parameter.name: Temperature Sensor 3 ID
Parameter.Help: Temperature Sensor 3 ID
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

Parameter.name: Temperature Sensor 4 ID
Parameter.Help: Temperature Sensor 4 ID
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

Parameter.name: Trip Distance from GPS
Parameter.Help: Trip Distance from GPS
Parameter.Notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the information provided by the GPS to calculate the odometer reading of the MHub. As this method uses the GPS, it is very important that the GPS will have coverage throughout the entire trip, as outages of GPS during a trip will cause inaccuracies in the calculation of the odometer.

Parameter.name: Trip Distance from Sensor
Parameter.Help: Trip Distance from Sensor
Parameter.Notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed sensor input as the source for distance (odometer) of the MHub. Note that it is important that the speed calibration is correctly done and is accurate when using the speed sensor as the source of distance.

Parameter.name: Trip Distance from Vehicle Network
Parameter.Help: Trip Distance from Vehicle Network
Parameter.Notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the Vehicle Network read distance as the source for distance (odometer) of the MHub.

Parameter.name: Trip End Delay
Parameter.Help: Delay after Ignition off before trip end indication
Parameter.Notes: This is similar to the trip start delay, whereby after ignition is turned off, the MHUb will wait for the number of seconds before generating the Trip End Event.

Parameter.name: Trip End Event Flush
Parameter.Help: Trip End Event Flush Enable
Parameter.Notes: With the bit set events will be flush at the end of a trip

Parameter.name: Trip Speed from GPS
Parameter.Help: Trip Speed from GPS
Parameter.Notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed provided by the GPS as a source for speed of the MHub.

Parameter.name: Trip Speed from Sensor
Parameter.Help: Trip Speed from Sensor
Parameter.Notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed sensor input as a source for speed of the MHub. Note that it is important that the speed calibration is correctly done and is accurate when using the speed sensor as the source of speed.

Parameter.name: Trip Speed from Vehicle Network
Parameter.Help: Trip Speed from Vehicle Network
Parameter.Notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed provided by the Vehicle Network connection as the source for speed of the MHub.

Parameter.name: Trip Start Delay
Parameter.Help: Delay after Ignition on before trip start indication
Parameter.Notes: When starting a vehicle, the cranking of the engine may result in the battery voltage fluctuating substantially, enough so to cause the ignition detection of the MHub to detect multiple ON/OFF transitions on the ignition line. Also if a driver is struggling to start a vehicle, the driver may attempt a number of sarts before the vehicle finally starts. In these cases the MHub should not generate many trip start end end events. In order to prevent multiple start and end events, this parameter will specify the time in seconds over hich the ignition line must be constantly ON before a valid trip start is detected. The default parameter is 10 seconds

Parameter.name: Trip Stationary Threshold
Parameter.Help: Speed Threshold at what vehicle is considered stationary
Parameter.Notes: It is possible to configure the MHub so that even if a vehicle is travelling very slowly, it is still deemed to be idling (standing still). This is also used to combat the effects of GPS speed jumps. Sometimes when a vehicle is stationary, the GPS sensor can report low speeds occasionally. Now if the vehicle is supposed to be in an Idle exception state at that time, it is important that the GPS reporting a speed of say 2KM/h does not cancel the excessive idle state. This parameter is used to specify the a speed in km/h below which the vehicle is deemed stationary.

Parameter.name: Enable USB
Parameter.Help: Enable the USB subsystem
Parameter.Notes: Setting this parameter to 1 will enable the USB on the MHub. It should always be turned ON.

Parameter.name: Enable USB Composite
Parameter.Help: Enable USB Composite
Parameter.Notes: Enable USB Composite. If enabled three USB COM Ports will enumerate.

Parameter.name: Product ID
Parameter.Help: Product ID
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Product ID

Parameter.name: USB Host Mode
Parameter.Help: 0 - USB is set to handle 81 Messages 1 - BLE Mode. USB transmits RAW data. Used for Bluetooth BLE Dongle. Any other value - Same as 0.
Parameter.Notes: 0 - USB is set to handle 81 Messages 1 - BLE Mode. USB transmits RAW data. Used for Bluetooth BLE Dongle. Any other value - Same as 0.

Parameter.name: USB Wake-up
Parameter.Help: USB Wake-up
Parameter.Notes: USB Wake-up if USB Host is connected to unit, it will wake up the unit from sleep

Parameter.name: Vendor ID
Parameter.Help: Vendor ID
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Vendor ID

Parameter.name: DTC Poll Time
Parameter.Help: The maximum amount of time from the start of a trip that the MHub will poll DTCs for OBD2 (Emissions related) and Detailed DTC information. If the vehicle starts moving then the polling process stops and the remaining time is zeroed.
Parameter.Notes: The maximum amount of time from the start of a trip that the MHub will poll DTCs for OBD2 (Emissions related) and Detailed DTC information. If the vehicle starts moving then the polling process stops and the remaining time is zeroed.

Parameter.name: Enable Detailed DTC Requests
Parameter.Help:
Enables UDS and KWP2000 DTC requests using services defined by the vehicle settings in XPlatform.
Note that certain vehicles respond to certain DTC requests by turning on the relevant sections. this could result in windscreen wipers activating or dashboard lights flickering or displaying warnings.
Parameter.Notes:
Enables UDS and KWP2000 DTC requests using services defined by the vehicle settings in XPlatform.
Note that certain vehicles respond to certain DTC requests by turning on the relevant sections. this could result in windscreen wipers activating or dashboard lights flickering or displaying warnings.

Parameter.name: Enable Mode 3 DTC Request
Parameter.Help: Enable OBD2 Mode3 DTC polling.
Parameter.Notes: Enable OBD2 Mode3 DTC polling.

Parameter.name: Enable Mode 7 DTC Request
Parameter.Help: Enables OBD2 Mode 7 DTC requests
Parameter.Notes: Enables OBD2 Mode 7 DTC requests

Parameter.name: Enable OBD2 DTC Scan on MIL Status Change
Parameter.Help: Allows the MHub to perform a Service-3 and Service-7 DTC poll (if enabled) if the MIL status changes during a trip.
Parameter.Notes: Allows the MHub to perform a Service-3 and Service-7 DTC poll (if enabled) if the MIL status changes during a trip.

Parameter.name: Enable Periodic DTC Checking
Parameter.Help: Enable Periodic DTC Checking
Parameter.Notes: Enable Periodic DTC Checking will request vehicle DTCs every 10 minutes inside of a trip.

Parameter.name: Allow Unsolicited CAN Message Parsing
Parameter.Help: Allows the MHub to use MProfiler supplied EOBD data to parse unsolicited vehicle proprietary data. This parameter should be managed by MProfiler.
Parameter.Notes: Allows the MHub to use MProfiler supplied EOBD data to parse unsolicited vehicle proprietary data. This parameter should be managed by MProfiler.

Parameter.name: Enable KWP2000 ISO14230-3
Parameter.Help: Enables the use of the ISO14230-3 Command Set. This should only be enabled on vehicles that are known to support this protocol.
Parameter.Notes: Enables the use of the ISO14230-3 Command Set. This should only be enabled on vehicles that are known to support this protocol.

Parameter.name: Enable UDS/ISO14229
Parameter.Help: Enables UDS/ISO14229 commands sent from XPlatform.
Parameter.Notes: Enables UDS/ISO14229 commands sent from XPlatform.

Parameter.name: EOBD Function Control
Parameter.Help:
Manages how the CAN bus is used by the MHub 0 - Full functionality. Sending and receiving of all EOBD protocols possible 166 [0xA6] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. UNSOLICITED MESSAGES PARSED. No commands sent. 172 [0xAC] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. Full KWP2000, UDS and unsolicited data. Useful for vehicles that do not support ISO15031.
Do not enable this if you do not understand the side effects and implications.
Parameter.Notes:
Manages how the CAN bus is used by the MHub 0 - Full functionality. Sending and receiving of all EOBD protocols possible 166 [0xA6] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. UNSOLICITED MESSAGES PARSED. No commands sent. 172 [0xAC] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. Full KWP2000, UDS and unsolicited data. Useful for vehicles that do not support ISO15031.
Do not enable this if you do not understand the side effects and implications.

Parameter.name: Lock Fake VIN for EOBD Data Requests
Parameter.Help: Prevents the use of the read vehicle VIN for requesting EOBD data. If Fake VIN is programmed then only this will be used to request data.
Parameter.Notes: Prevents the use of the read vehicle VIN for requesting EOBD data. If Fake VIN is programmed then only this will be used to request data.

Parameter.name: Pseudo (Fake) VIN
Parameter.Help: Used for requesting a parameter set from XPlatform that will be used to retrieve the true VIN from a particular vehicle type. Note: The length of the VIN must be 13 characters otherwise XPlatform will reject the ID. The ID supplied here will be prefaced with PSD_ to safeguard against accidental VIN entry.
Parameter.Notes: Used for requesting a parameter set from XPlatform that will be used to retrieve the true VIN from a particular vehicle type. Note: The length of the VIN must be 13 characters otherwise XPlatform will reject the ID. The ID supplied here will be prefaced with PSD_ to safeguard against accidental VIN entry.

Parameter.name: J1939 Filter Disable
Parameter.Help: J1939 Filter Disable
Parameter.Notes: J1939 Filter Disable will allow all CANBus messages to be received from the bus

Parameter.name: Calculated MAF Correction Factor
Parameter.Help: Used as internal correction to MAF calculated from EngineLoad and RPM. Value is entered as x1000. e.g to increase the calculated value by 25pc the factor needed be 1.25 Therefore the setting would be 1250 To decrease the value by 25pc the required factor would be 0.75 so the setting required would be 750
Parameter.Notes: Used as internal correction to MAF calculated from EngineLoad and RPM. Value is entered as x1000. e.g to increase the calculated value by 25pc the factor needed be 1.25 Therefore the setting would be 1250 To decrease the value by 25pc the required factor would be 0.75 so the setting required would be 750

Parameter.name: Enable Multi PID request
Parameter.Help: Enable Multi PID request
Parameter.Notes: Enable Multi PID request will request up to 6 PIDs per message.

Parameter.name: Enable OBD2 Login on CAN activity
Parameter.Help: Allows the initialisation of OBD when CAN activity is detected. Note: Needs Listen Only mode to be enabled to work.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Allows the initialisation of OBD when CAN activity is detected. Note: Needs Listen Only mode to be enabled to work.

Parameter.name: Enable Soft OBD Requests
Parameter.Help: This limits the time between two successive OBD requests to more than 1s. This softens the impact of the MHub on the vehicle ECU.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This limits the time between two successive OBD requests to more than 1s. This softens the impact of the MHub on the vehicle ECU. NB: SIDE EFFECTS This will reduce the resolution of all CAN data e.g speed, rpm and MAF due to the longer request period.

Parameter.name: Engine Coolant Temperature Limit
Parameter.Help: Engine Coolant Temperature Limit High Limit
Parameter.Notes: Configuration Temperature+40 with Temperature range -40 to 215 Degrees Celsius

Parameter.name: Engine Load Limit
Parameter.Help: Engine Load Limit
Parameter.Notes: Engine Load Limit in Percentage ranging from 0 to 100 Percent Load

Parameter.name: Engine Load Time Limit
Parameter.Help: Engine Load Exceedance Time Limit
Parameter.Notes: Minimum time in seconds for Engine Load to exceed the load limit before generating event

Parameter.name: Fast PID Request Frequency
Parameter.Help: Changes the frequency of of the Fast PID requests in 1/2 second intervals, e.g. a value of 4 equates to a 2 second request period. Maximum value is 7 which equates to a 3.5 second request. A value of 0 leaves the value as default 0.5s interval.
Parameter.Notes: Changes the frequency of of the Fast PID requests in 1/2 second intervals, e.g. a value of 4 equates to a 2 second request period. Maximum value is 7 which equates to a 3.5 second request. A value of 0 leaves the value as default 0.5s interval.

Parameter.name: Fuel Level Low Limit
Parameter.Help: Fuel Level Low Limit
Parameter.Notes: Fuel Low Warning Level in Percentage ranging from 0 to 100 Percent. If fuel level drops below Fuel Low Warning Level threshold an Fuel Low Event will be generated.

Parameter.name: OBD2 Fallback
Parameter.Help: OBD2 Fallback if GPS signal lost. Only log into OBD2 if GPS signal is not available.
Parameter.Notes: 0 - always use OBD2 fallback to GPS 1 - always use GPS fallback to OBD2 n - always use OBD2 fallback to GPS

Parameter.name: OBD2 Lockout
Parameter.Help: OBD2 Lockout time in seconds
Parameter.Notes: OBD2 Lockout time in seconds. If the MHub detects a scantool trying to log into CanBus the MHub will stand off for the Lockout period in seconds. Maximum of 254 seconds. Values of 0 and 255 will disable this feature.

Parameter.name: OBD2 PID Mask Extended
Parameter.Help: OBD2 PID Mask Extended: Add Bit value for Mask BIT Value Description 0 1 Lambda Sensor Reading 1 2 2 4 3 8 4 16 5 32 6 64 7 128 8 256 9 512 10 1024 11 2048 12 4096 13 8192 14 16384 15 32768
Parameter.Notes: OBD2 PID Mask Extended: Add Bit value for Mask BIT Value Description 0 1 Lambda Sensor Reading 1 2 2 4 3 8 4 16 5 32 6 64 7 128 8 256 9 512 10 1024 11 2048 12 4096 13 8192 14 16384 15 32768

Parameter.name: OBD2 PID Mask Fast
Parameter.Help:
OBD2 PID Mask Fast: Add VAL for Mask e.g. ENG SPEED, SPEED, MAF = 8+16+64=88
BIT Value Description 0 0 Reserved 1 2 Engine Load 2 0 Reserved 3 8 Engine Speed (RPM) 4 16 Vehicle Speed 5 0 Reserved 6 64 Mass Airflow (MAF) 7 128 Throttle Position 8 0 Reserved 9 0 Reserved 10 0 Reserved 11 2048 Manifold Air Pressure 12 0 Reserved 13 8192 Relative Accelerator Pedal Position 14 0 Reserved 15 0 Reserved
Parameter.Notes:
OBD2 PID Mask Fast: Add VAL for Mask e.g. ENG SPEED, SPEED, MAF = 8+16+64=88
BIT Value Description 0 0 Reserved 1 2 Engine Load 2 0 Reserved 3 8 Engine Speed (RPM) 4 16 Vehicle Speed 5 0 Reserved 6 64 Mass Airflow (MAF) 7 128 Throttle Position 8 0 Reserved 9 0 Reserved 10 0 Reserved 11 2048 Manifold Air Pressure 12 0 Reserved 13 8192 Relative Accelerator Pedal Position 14 0 Reserved 15 0 Reserved

Parameter.name: OBD2 PID Mask slow
Parameter.Help:
OBD2 PID Mask Fast: Add VAL for Mask e.g. MIL Status, ENG LOAD, THROTTLE POS=1+2+128=131
BIT Value Description 0 1 MIL Status 1 0 Reserved 2 4 Engine Coolant Temperature 3 0 Reserved 4 0 Reserved 5 32 Air Inlet Temperature 6 0 Reserved 7 0 Reserved 8 256 Fuel Level 9 512 Barometric Pressure 10 1024 Ambient Temperature 11 0 Reserved 12 4096 Distance Travelled since MIL cleared 13 0 Reserved 14 16384 Time Since Engine Start 15 32768 Ecu Voltage
Parameter.Notes:
OBD2 PID Mask Fast: Add VAL for Mask e.g. MIL Status, ENG LOAD, THROTTLE POS=1+2+128=131
BIT Value Description 0 1 MIL Status 1 0 Reserved 2 4 Engine Coolant Temperature 3 0 Reserved 4 0 Reserved 5 32 Air Inlet Temperature 6 0 Reserved 7 0 Reserved 8 256 Fuel Level 9 512 Barometric Pressure 10 1024 Ambient Temperature 11 0 Reserved 12 4096 Distance Travelled since MIL cleared 13 0 Reserved 14 16384 Time Since Engine Start 15 32768 Ecu Voltage

Parameter.name: Use OBD2 PID Mask
Parameter.Help: Use OBD2 PID Mask
Parameter.Notes: If Use OBD2 PID Mask is set to 1 the OBD2 Mask Slow and OBD2 Mask Fast will be use to determine what to request from OBD2. Any other value will disable the feature. Default is disabled.

Parameter.name: CAN Triggered Standoff Time
Parameter.Help: Sets the number of minutes that the unit will stand off from the CAN bus when a message from an ECU ID corresponding with CAN Standoff Trigger on XPlatform is detected. The intended use is to standoff when another diagnostic tool is detected on the bus.
Parameter.Notes: Sets the number of minutes that the unit will stand off from the CAN bus when a message from an ECU ID corresponding with CAN Standoff Trigger on XPlatform is detected. The intended use is to standoff when another diagnostic tool is detected on the bus.

Parameter.name: Enable CAN Controller Automatic Bus Off
Parameter.Help: Allow the CAN controller to automatically drop off the buss. NB: IT IS HIGHTLY RECOMMENDED NOT TO CHANGE THIS PARAMETER 0xAC (172) - Enable Auto Buss Off 0x53 (83) - Disable Auto Buss Off Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Allow the CAN controller to automatically drop off the buss. NB: IT IS HIGHTLY RECOMMENDED NOT TO CHANGE THIS PARAMETER 0xAC (172) - Enable Auto Buss Off 0x53 (83) - Disable Auto Buss Off Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active.

Parameter.name: Enable CAN Controller Automatic Retries
Parameter.Help: Allow the CAN controller to automatically retry any failed transmissions. On some vehicles this can cause buss interference. 0xAC (172) - Enable Automatic Retries 0x53 (83) - Disable Automatic Retries Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Allow the CAN controller to automatically retry any failed transmissions. On some vehicles this can cause buss interference. 0xAC (172) - Enable Automatic Retries 0x53 (83) - Disable Automatic Retries Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active.

Parameter.name: Enable J1939 FMS CANBus Interface
Parameter.Help: Enable J1939 FMS CANBus Interface. Note: Enable OBD2 CANBus Interface = 0
Parameter.Notes: If the J1939 FMS CANBus is connected to the MHub828 CANbus, this parameter needs to be set to 1 to enable the CAN Bus functionality. Disable the OBD2 CANbus interface

Parameter.name: Enable Listen Only Mode
Parameter.Help: Enables the controller to go into listen only mode after closing a session. NOTE: This is necessary to recover from some errors
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Enables the controller to go into listen only mode after closing a session. NOTE: This is necessary to recover from some errors

Parameter.name: Enable Vehicle CANBus Interface
Parameter.Help: Enable Vehicle On Board Diagnostics CANBus Interface Note: Enable J1939 FMS CANBus Interface = 0
Parameter.Notes: Enable ISO15765 Protocol interface using the CANBus interface. Disable the J1939 FMS CANBus Interface.

Parameter.name: Enable Vehicle K Line Interface
Parameter.Help: Enable Vehicle On Board Diagnostics Interface
Parameter.Notes: Enable ISO9141 and ISO14230 network interface using the LIN line

Parameter.name: Enhanced Protocol Selection ID
Parameter.Help:
0 - Use automatic detection for OBD protocols. 6 - Mobile Eye
60 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 61 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Active (Not MHub855) 62 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 63 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Active (Not MHub855)
100 - CAN 500kb / 11-bit OBD requests 129 - CAN 500kb / 29-bit OBD requests 210 - K-Line Fast Initialisation 250 - CAN 250kb / 11-bit 220 - TP2 Instrument 221 - TP2 Engine
All other values default to Mobile Eye Parameter Set
Parameter.Notes:
0 - Use automatic detection for OBD protocols. 6 - Mobile Eye
60 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 61 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Active (Not MHub855) 62 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 63 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Active (Not MHub855)
100 - CAN 500kb / 11-bit OBD requests 129 - CAN 500kb / 29-bit OBD requests 210 - K-Line Fast Initialisation 250 - CAN 250kb / 11-bit 220 - TP2 Instrument 221 - TP2 Engine
All other values default to Mobile Eye Parameter Set

Parameter.name: ISO15765 250kBaud Disable
Parameter.Help: Disable 250kBaud detection.
Parameter.Notes: Disable 250kBaud detection.

Parameter.name: OBC 500kbps J1939 FMS CANBus
Parameter.Help: Verify with vehicle manufacturer if the CANBus should be 500kbps Baudrate before setting this parameter.
Parameter.Notes:
For 250kbps set OBC 500kbps J1939 FMS CANBus = 0, for 500kbps set OBC 500kbps J1939 FMS CANBus = 1.
The FMS Standard specifies the baudrate to be 250kbps.

Parameter.name: OBC Active J1939 FMS CANBus
Parameter.Help: Enable Active J1939 FMS CANBus
Parameter.Notes: Verify with vehicle manufacturer if the CANBus should be Active of Passive before setting this parameter.

Parameter.name: TP 2.0 Enable
Parameter.Help: Enable TP 2.0 Protocol used by VW Group vehicles; VW, Seat, Audi, etc
Parameter.Notes: Enable TP 2.0 Protocol used by VW Group vehicles; VW, Seat, Audi, etc

Parameter.name: Vehicle Network Interface Path
Parameter.Help:
Selects the routing for VNI messages
0 - Onboard CAN Interface, internal processing (Default) 1 - Extender CAN Interface, internal processing 2 - SLCan Interface, Internal Processing
10 - Onboard CAN Interface, ELM Emulation (Selected Devices) 11 - Extender CAN Interface, ELM Emulation (Selected Devices) 12 - SLCan Interface, ELM Emulation (Selected Devices)
Parameter.Notes:
Selects the routing for VNI messages
0 - Onboard CAN Interface, internal processing (Default) 1 - Extender CAN Interface, internal processing 2 - SLCan Interface, Internal Processing
10 - Onboard CAN Interface, ELM Emulation (Selected Devices) 11 - Extender CAN Interface, ELM Emulation (Selected Devices) 12 - SLCan Interface, ELM Emulation (Selected Devices)

Parameter.name: VNI Compatibility Mode
Parameter.Help: Relaxes timings on some protocols to enable compatibility with older vehicles.
Parameter.Notes: Relaxes timings on some protocols to enable compatibility with older vehicles.

Parameter.name: Axle 0 Location
Parameter.Help: Axle 0 Location
Parameter.Notes: Axle 0 Location. Axle location bit-mapped position number counting front to back facing forward.

Parameter.name: Axle 0 Tyre Location
Parameter.Help: Axle 0 Tyre Location
Parameter.Notes: Axle 0 Tyre Location. Tyre location Bit-mapped counting left to right facing forward.

Parameter.name: Axle 1 Location
Parameter.Help: Axle 1 Location
Parameter.Notes: Axle 1 Location. Axle location bit-mapped position number counting front to back facing forward.

Parameter.name: Axle 1 Tyre Location
Parameter.Help: Axle 1 Tyre Location
Parameter.Notes: Axle 1 Tyre Location. Tyre location Bit-mapped counting left to right facing forward.

Parameter.name: Axle Weight Change Limit
Parameter.Help: Change in Axle weight (kg) from start of trip exceeding this limit will be reported. 0 disables the function.
Parameter.Notes: Change in Axle weight from start of trip exceeding this limit will be reported. 0 disables the function.

Parameter.name: Cargo Ambient Temperature Lower Limit
Parameter.Help: Lower limit of temperature of air inside vehicle container used to accommodate cargo. -273 degC offset.
Parameter.Notes: Lower limit of temperature of air inside vehicle container used to accommodate cargo. -273 degC offset.

Parameter.name: Cargo Ambient Temperature Upper Limit
Parameter.Help: Upper limit of temperature of air inside vehicle container used to accommodate cargo. -273 degC offset.
Parameter.Notes: Upper limit of temperature of air inside vehicle container used to accommodate cargo. -273 degC offset.

Parameter.name: Cargo Weight Change Limit
Parameter.Help: Change in Cargo weight (kg) from start of trip exceeding this limit will be reported. 0 disables the function.
Parameter.Notes: Change in Cargo weight (kg) from start of trip exceeding this limit will be reported. 0 disables the function.

Parameter.name: Custom J1939 PGN 0
Parameter.Help: Custom J1939 Parameter Group Number 0
Parameter.Notes: Custom J1939 Parameter Group Number 0. A three byte, 24bit number that uniquely identifies a particular Parameter Group.

Parameter.name: Custom J1939 PGN 1
Parameter.Help: Custom J1939 Parameter Group Number 1.
Parameter.Notes: Custom J1939 Parameter Group Number 1. A three byte, 24bit number that uniquely identifies a particular Parameter Group.

Parameter.name: Enable Custom 3 Event
Parameter.Help: Enable Custom 3 Event triggered by Driver Identification change

Parameter.name: Enable TCO Change Event Generation
Parameter.Help: Enable TCO Change Event Generation will generate a FMS Data event everytime TCO variable changes value.
Parameter.Notes: Enable TCO Change Event Generation will generate a FMS Data event everytime TCO variable changes value. FMS Data Event has to enables under Event Configuraion.

Parameter.name: Engine Coolant Level Minimum
Parameter.Help: Minimum ratio of volume of liquid found in engine cooling system to total cooling system volume.
Parameter.Notes: Minimum ratio of volume of liquid found in engine cooling system to total cooling system volume.

Parameter.name: Engine Coolant Pressure Lower Limit
Parameter.Help: Lower Gage pressure limit of liquid found in engine cooling system. 2kPa/count.
Parameter.Notes: Lower Gage pressure limit of liquid found in engine cooling system. 2kPa/count.

Parameter.name: Engine Coolant PressureUpper Limit
Parameter.Help: Upper Gage pressure limit of liquid found in engine cooling system. 2kPa/count.
Parameter.Notes: Upper Gage pressure limit of liquid found in engine cooling system. 2kPa/count.

Parameter.name: Engine Coolant Temperature Lower Limit
Parameter.Help: Lower Temperature limit of liquid found in engine cooling system. -40 degrees C offset.
Parameter.Notes: Lower Temperature limit of liquid found in engine cooling system. -40 degrees C offset.

Parameter.name: Engine Coolant Temperature Upper Limit
Parameter.Help: Upper Temperature limit of liquid found in engine cooling system. -40 degrees C offset.
Parameter.Notes: Upper Temperature limit of liquid found in engine cooling system. -40 degrees C offset.

Parameter.name: Engine Displacement (ml)
Parameter.Help:
Total engine displacement in ml. For example a 2 litre engine would have a value such as 1956 which would be the volumetric displacement of all pistons in all cylinders. This value is unique to each engine model.
This value is needed for the calculation of Fuel Usage where Mass Air Flow is not supplied by the vehicle and Absolute Load is supplied instead. Most diesel vehicles will require this parameter to be entered if Fuel usage is to be calculated.
Parameter.Notes:
Total engine displacement in ml. For example a 2 litre engine would have a value such as 1956 which would be the volumetric displacement of all pistons in all cylinders. This value is unique to each engine model.
This value is needed for the calculation of Fuel Usage where Mass Air Flow is not supplied by the vehicle and Absolute Load is supplied instead. Most diesel vehicles will require this parameter to be entered if Fuel usage is to be calculated.

Parameter.name: Engine Oil Level Minimum
Parameter.Help: Minimum ratio of current volume of engine sump oil to maximum required volume.
Parameter.Notes: Ratio of current volume of engine sump oil to maximum required volume.

Parameter.name: Engine Oil Pressure Lower Limit
Parameter.Help: Lower Gage pressure Limit of oil in engine lubrication system as provided by oil pump. 4kPa/count.
Parameter.Notes: Lower Gage pressure Limit of oil in engine lubrication system as provided by oil pump. 4kPa/count.

Parameter.name: Engine Oil Pressure Upper Limit
Parameter.Help: Upper Gage pressure Limit of oil in engine lubrication system as provided by oil pump. 4kPa/count.
Parameter.Notes: Upper Gage pressure Limit of oil in engine lubrication system as provided by oil pump. 4kPa/count.

Parameter.name: Force MAF from Rpm and Engine Load
Parameter.Help: If enabled the MAF will be calculated from RPM and Engine Load and not read MAF. NB BE SURE TO SELECT MAF Calculation Source if this parameter is set
Parameter.Notes: If enabled the MAF will be calculated from RPM and Engine Load and not read MAF. NB BE SURE TO SELECT MAF Calculation Source if this parameter is set

Parameter.name: J1939 Event Debounce Time
Parameter.Help: Number of seconds between repeats of the same event to prevent malfunctioning sensors or boundary conditions from causing excessive events. Timers are reset at trip start and not stored through reboot.
Parameter.Notes: Number of seconds between repeats of the same event to prevent malfunctioning sensors or boundary conditions from causing excessive events. Timers are reset at trip start.

Parameter.name: J1939 FMS Vehicle Info Report Interval
Parameter.Help: J1939 FMS Vehicle Info Report Interval
Parameter.Notes: J1939 FMS Vehicle Info Report Interval in seconds. This Event will only be sent during trip.

Parameter.name: MAF Calculation Source
Parameter.Help: Selects the source of parameters used to extrapolate MAF. Note that unless the Force MAF calculation setting is enabled, read MAF will always be preferred if available. 0 - No MAF calculation. Only use READ MAF values 1 - Use best available option 2 - Use only Calculated Engine Load PID 3 - Use only Absolute Engine Load PID
Parameter.Notes: Selects the source of parameters used to extrapolate MAF. Note that unless the Force MAF calculation setting is enabled, read MAF will always be preferred if available. 0 - No MAF calculation. Only use READ MAF values 1 - Use best available option 2 - Use only Calculated Engine Load PID 3 - Use only Absolute Engine Load PID

Parameter.name: OBC Calculate Fuel from Equation
Parameter.Help: OBC Calculate Fuel from Equation
Parameter.Notes: OBC Calculate Fuel from Equation. Populate OBC Weight and Fuel Model parameters

Parameter.name: OBC Calculate J1939 FMS Fuel Used
Parameter.Help: Calculate J1939 FMS Fuel Used
Parameter.Notes: If Fuel Used is not provided by the vehicle FMS network, but Fuel Economy is, you can estimate fuel used.

Parameter.name: OBC Calculate J1939 FMS Fuel Used from L per hour
Parameter.Help: OBC Calculate J1939 FMS Fuel Used from L per hour
Parameter.Notes: If Fuel Used is not provided by the vehicle FMS network, but Fuel Rate is, you can estimate fuel used.

Parameter.name: OBC Calculate J1939 FMS Fuel Used from Total Fuel
Parameter.Help: OBC Calculate J1939 FMS Fuel Used from Total Fuel
Parameter.Notes: OBC Calculate J1939 FMS Fuel Used from Total Fuel. The difference of total fuel at the beginning and end of the trip is used to calculate Fuel

Parameter.name: OBC Use J1939 FMS Trip Fuel
Parameter.Help: Use the J1939 FMS Trip Fuel variable for Trip Fuel
Parameter.Notes: Use the J1939 FMS Trip Fuel variable for Trip Fuel. Not standard FMS Variable.

Parameter.name: Percent Clutch Slip
Parameter.Help: Limit of ratio of input shaft speed to current engine speed (in percent).
Parameter.Notes: Limit of ratio of input shaft speed to current engine speed (in percent).

Parameter.name: Percent Engine Load Limit
Parameter.Help: The ratio of actual engine percent torque (indicated) to maximum indicated torque available at the current engine speed, clipped to zero torque during engine braking.
Parameter.Notes: The ratio of actual engine percent torque (indicated) to maximum indicated torque available at the current engine speed, clipped to zero torque during engine braking.

Parameter.name: Periodic Custom CanBus Delay
Parameter.Help: Periodic Custom CanBus Delay to be used in Event Generation
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: Periodic FMS CanBus Delay
Parameter.Help: Periodic CanBus Delay to be used in Event Generation.

Parameter.name: Periodic Update Event Period
Parameter.Help: Number of seconds between update of select J1939 data. Triggering of this event will only occur during a trip if valid J1939 messages are being received for the data contained in the events. 0 - Disable function.
Parameter.Notes: Number of seconds between update of select J1939 data. Triggering of this event will only occur during a trip if valid J1939 messages are being received for the data contained in the events. 0 - Disable function.

Parameter.name: Trailer Weight Change Limit
Parameter.Help: Change in Trailer weight (kg) from start of trip exceeding this limit will be reported. 0 disables the function.
Parameter.Notes: Change in Axle weight (kg) from start of trip exceeding this limit will be reported. 0 disables the function.

Parameter.name: Transmission Oil Level Lower Limit
Parameter.Help: Lower limit of the Ratio of volume of transmission sump oil to recommended volume.
Parameter.Notes: Lower limit of the Ratio of volume of transmission sump oil to recommended volume.

Parameter.name: Transmission Oil Pressure Lower Limit
Parameter.Help: Lower Gage pressure limit of lubrication fluid in transmission, measured after pump. 16kPa/count.
Parameter.Notes: Lower Gage pressure limit of lubrication fluid in transmission, measured after pump. 16kPa/count.

Parameter.name: Transmission Oil Pressure Upper Limit
Parameter.Help: Upper Gage pressure limit of lubrication fluid in transmission, measured after pump. 16kPa/count.
Parameter.Notes: Upper Gage pressure limit of lubrication fluid in transmission, measured after pump. 16kPa/count.

Parameter.name: Transmission Oil Temperature Lower Limit
Parameter.Help: Upper Temperature limit of the transmission lubricant. -273 degC offset.
Parameter.Notes: Upper Temperature limit of the transmission lubricant. -273 degC offset.

Parameter.name: Transmission Oil Temperature Upper Limit
Parameter.Help: Upper Temperature limit of the transmission lubricant. -273 degC offset.
Parameter.Notes: Upper Temperature limit of the transmission lubricant. -273 degC offset.

Parameter.name: Trip Fuel Use Interval
Parameter.Help: Interval in litres between updates in the amount of fuel used during a trip. E.g. if the value is set to 10 then every 10 litres of fuel used during a trip will be reported. 0 - turns reporting off.
Parameter.Notes: Interval in litres between updates in the amount of fuel used during a trip. E.g. if the value is set to 10 then every 10 litres of fuel used during a trip will be reported. 0 - turns reporting off.
